I went to Apple and they said my battery health is low but I only replaced it a month ago. Anyways they said “they use Apple parts” they don’t mean brand new battery. Apple said that the screen a terrible after market screen. I also got a charger from there and the charger messed up my port. Customer service is good but not good quality of products.

resp.text:
Hey Shaniya. I'm sorry to hear that. But we do use OEM batteries and Premium plus screen for iPhone. And Our charger Cable they are OEM charger. Plus we do have 90 days warranty on all repair. If you stop by I will make sure to fix the problem. And make you satisfied wherever it takes. Please give me a call 334 413 1114.
Thank you and have a nice day.

text: Often ripped off and insulted.

name: Evita B
text:
My husband cracked the screen of my Note 8 by accident and I didn't want to replace it. Found this place and decided to give it a try. They had to order my screen and we paid in advance. Asked about insurance, which we don't have on my phone because I've never broken any of my phones. The guy at the counter kept commenting on how expensive it was going to be.... okay, so?... I want my phone fixed and your business does this right...?

We paid and were told it would take 3 to 5 days for the screen to come in; they would call me and I could come in and have the phone's screen replaced in an hour or so. 10 days pass and no one calls me. My husband calls them and they say the screen is in and I can come in and get it replaced. They then try to call me, but I was unavailable. The next day, he drops the phone off as soon as they open at 10am, and was informed that the only one who could fix it wasn't there yet. He would be there in 45mins and it would take 2hrs to fix the screen. 2 hrs....

My husband decided to go to the gym, then come home and clean up. He called them at 2pm and my phone was still being worked on: they said give him more time. He arrived there after 3:30pm and the phone was not finished being repaired. Decided to pick up dinner next door. Still not done. So finally, around 4pm it is finished. It works and has a lifetime warranty for the pressure sensitivity. This was one thing I was concerned about: the screen's pressure sensitivity.

I get my phone and inspect it. It was not even sealed properly! Therefore, it is not waterproof anymore, and not resellable. Annoyed, I go to the shop myself and the tech who worked on my phone is very apologetic, admits it was done incorrectly, but is unable to help me. He said he was busy and trying to hurry because my husband had been waiting for a while. Still has a lot of things to work on; I could leave it overnight, come by tomorrow. Maybe it would get done. I can't leave my phone there overnight, and I can't come back the next day. He was going to try and put weight on the phone before taking the screen off and resealing it.

That is what I'm trying to do now: put weight on it. I wrapped it in screen cleaning cloths and set a gallon water jug on it. About 7 or 8 lbs. I asked him how much weight, but he never answered me, telling me instead about the warranty. The warranty is for the screen's pressure sensitivity.

I'd rather have it take a long time and done correctly, than rushed and crappy. Now, I'm trying to correctly their mistake. I don't think pressing it down with weight will help. It is misaligned somewhere, and not glued and seal properly.

Paid $340 to have my phone's screen replaced and they didn't do it properly. The back part is spongy; you press down and it comes back up. The whole left side was not placed correctly or glued down properly. Would never go here again. And would urge everyone to not waste their time until the people at CPR have better organization and attention to detail. They also seem like they need more knowledgeable people. My husband was told this tech had never worked on a Samsung Note 8 and that one of them only works on computers and laptops; no phones at all. Cell Phone Repair.

resp.text: It sounds like you love the Note 8 and we do too. Please return the device to the store so we can help out.

name: Kyle H
text: I went in trying to get my charging port repaired and was told they would have to destroy the screen and the repair would be over $200. I was advised instead to purchase a wireless charger elsewhere and a battery from them since mine was weak. I did buy the battery from them and they came from the back with a battery that had no seal or package and sold it to me for $40 and took my old battery, which it would not charge past 20% until I bought a new battery from another location indicating they sold me a used battery as new. What they didn't inform me was that my phone was not wireless charging capable. I went back to try and get a refund but I was never given a receipt and they said they can't do anything about it since they have no records of them selling it to me. Not only am I now stuck with a used battery that was sold as a new but was given false information. I took my business to another phone repair shop that was capable of performing my repair at $65 compared to their quoted $200 and my screen never had to be shattered. I advise not conducting any business with this store if you need anything because you may end up with used parts and misleading information.

resp.text:
Hi Kyle, I wish you would have contacted us directly regarding this. We would have been happy to explain why this is the way that it is.

The repair shop that you brought your device to has the capability of micro soldering a new charging port to the existing cable. We do not have that capability which means that we must remove the entire flex cable to change the port. The problem with that is the navigation buttons that are on the phone are sealed under the screen and wrap around to the charge port. Meaning for us to get those out we must lift the screen after heating it substantially. It’s very risky and leads to cracked LCDs in most cases.

We NEVER want to take advantage of anyone. We set expectations for everything. We would rather you know the entire truth before going with our service.

Now, to the battery. We buy batteries in bulk which do not come in “retail” packaging. We would have gladly given you a full refund on that item if it was not working up to our standards.

As you can see from most of our reviews, we go above and beyond for our customers. A $40 battery would not be worth losing a customer over.

I will still gladly refund the $40 if you come in and ask for Jessie.

As I appreciate the feedback I believe a 1 star review isn’t warranted in this case. We just lack the capabilities in making that specific repair cheaper.

The reality is the explanation you were given is 100% accurate because we would need to replace the screen as well which cost well over $100 just to get it to our shop.

I am happy that you were able to get it fixed elsewhere and for cheaper. We cannot speak to other repair shops capabilities, only our own.

Thanks for your consideration and please come see us for your refund.

Jessie

text: Takes your money and computers, never fixes and only returns your money and device under threat of filing police report. When they finally showed he refused to show and sent is wife. Since my experience I have come in contact with numerous other people that have had the same experience but have never gotten their money or laptops back. He’s very unprofessional, refuses to keep customers in the loop as to what’s going on and I feel if I had not threatened to get police involved I would have never gotten my money back or my laptop.

name: James Buxton
text: I gave my daughters laptop to him to fix before her birthday on the 18th. I asked how much money and he said $146. When I went to meet him it all of a sudden jumped to $200. I tried contacting him on NUMEROUS occasions to get an update. He ignored all my calls, texts & messages. I requested the tracking number so I could check the status of the order,he refused. I was given numerous excuses why the part wasn’t in: the part came in and it was wrong part, ups never showed up (x15), promised to give me tracking number numerous occasions but never received it, then his wife called me to say he was deathly ill. But not so Ill that he couldn’t be on Facebook. I demanded my money ($200 cash) and the laptop in the condition I gave it to him in. I told them I wanted it that day but I again wet off their word and let them talk me into the 7th at straight up 3:30 pm. Of course 3:30 arrived and they were no show. I texted and he said another 15. I gave him a choice, show up with my lap top and my money or I go to police. His wife finally shows up, practically throws the $200 cash as me and hands me the lap top. I would highly encourage anyone considering using D-Tech computer services in Valley, AL..........DON’T.

name: Drake Roberts
text:
Just left this place never been till now I came in looking for a Lenovo laptop charger and the man behind the counter said he doesn't know if he had any new and said he was not sure if he had any used and suggested Walmart
Didn't even make an attempt to check only said he wasn't sure then auggsugge I go elsewhere I got the feeling I was bothering him just by being a customer would not recommend and will never be back

resp.text: Thanks for your review. I just reviewed the recording to be sure you were helped as best as possible. We are a repair shop, and as such are unable to carry every different brand and model adapter. Dylan knew right off the bat that we do not carry the new Lenovo adapter you were searching for. We have in shop adapters that we use for repairs, he should have been more clear about his response. He also recommended Walmart, because he was trying to help you find the adapter. He gave you a card and asked you to keep us in mind in case you had anything we could help you with. Sorry you felt like he was dismissive, but we simply did not have what you were looking for. Best of luck on your search.

name: David Hill
text: Strictly about getting as much of your money for as little as possible.Deceptive and highly overpriced.Be sure you already know what's wrong before you bring your Pc there,if not they'll make it worse before making it better and charge 3 Times as much as original problem should have been.

resp.text:
Hi Stranger! Are you sure you left a review for the correct business? I have no record of you in my system, and I can assure you I would be aware of any such interaction as the one you described. I would love to hear from you, we do our best to correct any situation. 2519294609

Also, if you're able to provide me with the time that you interacted with my techs, I'll be sure to review any phone calls or video of the shop to make sure our high standards are being met. I'm having trouble understanding your review for a few reasons -

1- I have no documented interactions with you and am unable to reach you.
2- We NEVER charge for anything without the customers approval.
3- We always take into account the value of the equipment brought to us so we can justify the cost of repair. Unfortunately, a lot of equipment brought in for repair is not worth the cost of repair. We decline to repair a lot of equipment. In these situations we offer alternative solutions such as migrating to a new computer, or providing a backup so you can purchase equipment elsewhere.
4- There is another business in the area with a very similar name that has caused confusion in the past. I cannot speak to the quality of the work they perform, I just know we have been mistaken for them quite often.

Still looking forward to speaking with you personally and clearing up any confusion.
Judge Keeler - 251.929.4609

name: Gulf Bay Photography
text: I dropped off a pc due to freezing on monday night. They had it all week and picked it up on friday night. They stated it was the second hard drive causing the issues and all was perfect. I got home tonight plugged it in and froze up within 1 minute. How do you have a pc a whole week and the first minute I get it plugged back in the pc freezes again? Something is wrong and the problem was not diagnosed properly.

resp.text: Thanks for your review Ben. Ive followed up several times and not heard back from you. I apologize for the time frame, hope you were able to find the help you were looking for.

name: david truedale
text: So i had alot of problems with the motherboard and helped me narrow it down to being the prongs on the motherboard, at the end day it was the help i needed. #Willusethemagain

resp.text: Thanks David! Looking forward to hearing back from you when you're up and running.

name: Kim Tracey ella
text: The best problem fixers ever!!!!

resp.text: Thanks Kim!

name: Mary T
text:
DO NOT USE THIS PLACE!!!

Took in my Galaxy S7 Edge after I dropped it and screen turned green and flickered. Everything else was working great, including charging.

Was told it needed new screen. Paid $230 with my debit card and was then informed that there would be no warranty. Got an email receipt.

Got my phone back a few days later and it was down to 1%. So I immediately tried to charge it and got an error message that the battery temp was too low to charge.

Went in the next morning and was told it needed a new battery because old battery would not charge new LED screen (which I should have been told on first visit). Paid $60 MORE. Also told there was no tax since I paid with cash and was not offered a receipt nor one by email (like previous time).

My husband picks the phone up, tries to charge it and gets the SAME error message.

He calls them and is now told that the motherboard is probably bad and it needs a new one. NO FLIPPING WAY was I giving them another dime!!

I am out almost $300 and STILL have no phone to use!!!

They basically  just took my money and did not fix my phone.

I DO NOT recommend this place AT ALL and will be contacting BBB!

resp.text: Mam, I'm sorry that the repair did not work out to your satisfaction. We did everything in our power to help you with your phone. And provided you with every option at our disposal. And we did everything that we could over the phone to explain to you the error that your phone was still having from both me and my assistant. Unfortunately sometimes when performing a repair, be it on a car a house or an electronic device there is more wrong with it than just the issue that you drop it off for. These issues are unfortunate, nonetheless, but sometimes they are there. I apologize you're unsatisfied, and if you change your mind and decide to get the device fixed as we said on the phone, the amount that you have already paid for the battery repair will apply towards the motherboard. I hope you have a great day and if you need anything else give us a call!!

name: Kim McConnon
text: Best place around! Easy to get affordable phone repairs! Much appreciated! They are knowledgeable and make it stress free

name: Blair McAbee
text:
Although my phone was repaired, I will not recomend them. I do not trust businesses that ask for payment up front and then tell you they have a no refund policy if their service comes into question. Just because you call something a store policy, does not make it legally or morally correct.
I award this business a negative one star rating.

resp.text: Glad that your phone works! I cannot find a ticket for repair with your info on it ... Nonetheless, the business policies that we've developed over the years are a direct reflection on experiences we've had in the past. And I assure you in this industry they are very commonplace. The parts that we use do carry a warranty. Again glad to hear that your phone's doing well, you need anything please let us know!

text: Was quoted one price, called the next day and was told it would be an extra $20 for overnight shipping even though the day before was told it would also arrive the next day for repair. Ended up taking over a week to come in and so when I dropped it off I requested the extra fee be refunded. Guy took an attitude about it but agreed. When I picked it up the next day I asked if it had been refunded. The woman told me I was ridiculous and just handed me a $20 bill Extremely unprofessional.

resp.text:
Hi Brandon!!!
We did order your part for overnight delivery, unfortunately due to an error in FedEx system we did not receive it overnight. I do remember the conversation with you and did agree that it would be no issue to refund you the overnight shipping. We received the part and had it in your hands today as well as the refund. and after watching the tape I couldn't find a single instance where my employee called you ridiculous. But nonetheless, I apologize that you had an unpleasant experience and we look forward to helping you next time should the need arise. Have a great day!!

text: I had a great experience,great customer service. This store was the only store to have my parts in stock. They had my phone fixed in 20 mins and they were the cheapest. I highly recommend CELL REPAIRS PLUS

name: Harper Lee
text:
Total scam. First you pay 40 dollars to get the phone evaluated which was not explained from the start, then another hundred for a potential repair not a guaranteed repair mind you! I should have just got a replacement from my phone company for a hundred. I was trying to get my contacts. What a waste of forty dollars time  and potentially wasting a total of
140 dollars with no guarantee! He must pay for reviews as he is not credible or honest! Unbelievable, he is still in business! Don’t trust anything he says or states! Go elsewhere,  anywhere but there! Trust me there are far more reputable honest folks that charge the right amount to start and either can or can not do the repair.

I am reporting him to better business bureau for his deception and dishonesty.

resp.text:
Miss Lee we wish you the best as we did on the phone the other day. We charge 40 $ to diagnose any device that comes in unresponsive, to cover our costs  and then apply that money towards the total cost of the repair if the customer chooses to do so. We explain that without fail every time we do a diagnostic. I apologize for any misunderstanding that you had with us in our initial conversation.

We take the word guarantee very seriously, and would never guarantee repair on a phone we haven't seen in months. That Miss Lee and that alone is why would not guarantee a repair. We do guarantee our repairs and most of all parts have a lifetime warranty. I'm sorry that you felt that this review was necessary as well as  the conversation and language you used with us on the phone the other day was necessary but we do sincerely wish you the best.

JF

name: Luis Palacios
text: Honestly hands down amazing work in record time. With unbeatable prices. They have fixed my phone on multiple occasions. Screen or battery have never been disappointed. I recommend them if you ever have any issues with any device.

text:
I went in awhile back to get a computer fixed.

The PSU had blown and it wouldn't turn on. I bought a new PSU and asked them to fix it, the guy told me that the motherboard had fried and was damaged beyond repair.

Fast forward a month later and one of my friends took one look at it and said that that guy had no idea what he was doing, plugged in a different PSU and it turned on.

I would also like to point out the guy that I took this to, decided to unplug all the cables even the fans and leds.

Great guy and great business!
You get the true measure of a business and a businessman when things don't go perfectly the first time.  I had a problem that Mike thought he had fixed because it never manifested itself while he had the computer, so then when I got it home it came back.  He immediately went back to work and made it right.  Computer works great!  He also was more than fair about all his additional labor and parts.  He knows his stuff!  Great guy and great business!

name: Melissa Kirkland
text: I had a problem with a slow computer and emails that were not being received or sent correctly or timely. Dothan PC corrected the problems with my computer but I still could not send and receive emails normally. Mike had installed Office 2010 Suite and rechecked the computer and it worked fine in his office. He told me I had a connectivity problem and contact my service provider. I did they told me no problems where showing up and that it wasn't connectivity I should call the Software company. I did, they walked me through the proper set ups (3 possible) none worked. They wanted to sell me 2016 Office Suite. I said no. I checked with Mike again he said you have a connectivity (Router / Modem) problem check again with service provider. I did send someone out and the technician saw my Router turned around went back to his truck and brought in a new one and set it up. It worked great after the new router was installed and cleared up all problems. Mike was right all along I got the run around for just over a month before resolution. Mike has never steered me wrong or wanted to do something just for the money. He is honest and worthy of your business. I am a long time happy customer!.

resp.text: Thank You Melissa for your business. call anytime :-)

name: MaryBeth Winter
text: I had horrible luck and dropped my iMac, cracking the screen as I was unpacking from our move. PC Tech Computer Repair was the second place I called after a store in Enterprise, AL told me they were the closest place that repaired Apple Computers. The employees at PC Tech Repair displayed genuine customer service. They were kind, honest, fair, and repaired my computer in a timely manner. The screen they ordered to fix my computer was cracked worse than my original, they promptly called me and communicated that it would take longer to repair because they had to order an additional and have it shipped. I appreciated this communication so much!  Upon pick up, I came in with my 1 year old and the guy even helped to carry my repaired computer to my car! I will be using PC Tech Repair for any of my future tech needs and will definitely be recommending them to friends! Their customer service was phenomenal (which is what truly matters!)

text: I decided to go to PC Tech due to the positive feedback I saw on google reviews. I had an issue with my computer charge port so I dropped it off to get it diagnosed for repair. I was later told it was the DC jack needing replaced and the repair would cost 150.00. I was blown away at the price so I decided to think on it. Shawn told me the part alone cost 50 dollars. I told him I would rather look around for another computer and I would like to pick up my computer. He told me come on by and pick it up the following day. A few days later I decided to pull it apart and see how detailed the work was. As I took it apart I noticed there was no hard drive in it. I called Shawn as he proceeded to say that that happens sometimes and his kid must have forgot to put it back in when they were looking for the issue. Additionally I found the part on eBay new for less than 20 dolllars. Not to mention the fact that the diagnoses when they originally took it apart would have been an extra screw to replace the DC jack which he tried charging me another 100 bucks. All together a very bad experience and I would rather avoid this place at all cost.

name: Kirkland Brown
text: Since we got our couch. We’ev been missing a piece. Yet we paid full price & they assured us it was going to be here in two months almost 3 months l8r. No other piece & still more excuses. Just go to a REAL furniture place. They can’t even call us & give us updates.

resp.text:
I am very sorry you are unhappy  Mr. Brown
Unfortunately I think you have the wrong furniture store as we do not have you in our system as having made a purchase with us.

However,  I would like to address your complaint about a furniture establishment.

Unfortunately for most businesses selling anything in America we are faced with challenges that are out of our control. For example,   there are shipping delays from overseas of products that are needed here for the assembly of furniture and chips for new cars.  Because of those delays dates change every day. When we do let our customers know a date, it can change the same afternoon which frustrates the customer even more.

Before the Pandemic, we could deliver on 90% of our goods within a 2-4 week time period. Now we cannot promise any date...the only thing we ask is that you hold on to your old furniture until your new furniture  arrives. We have even loaned out new furniture while a customer waits.
We have wholesale prices right now to help with that unfortunate waiting period. Some items come in next week after delivery, but some do not. It varies with every piece.

We value our customers, and if we could change what is going on in America we would . We go above and beyond for all of our customers. I just ask that you try and understand the circumstances that all retail establishments are having to deal with and navigate through. They are difficult, and we are all trying our best to get your items here as quickly as we can.
Factories in America are also understaffed, and those who are working are doing their very best as well. Transportation is trying to find more drivers, so that items can also be delivered in a timely fashion.
We have kept our prices  lower than anyone  to help better ease that frustration of timely delivery dates. So it is a great time to purchase from us, but patience will be needed in case dates change on an item.
Thank you so much for your understanding, and if you did purchase from us under a different name - I am sorry for the delays, and I too wished we had control over dates fluctuating.

name: Catherine Hatter
text: If you are looking for furniture, appliances, or televisions, please stop by this location. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. They greet you with a smile and are willing to answer any questions you have. The prices are also amazing! This is an all around great place to purchase all of your home decor needs. Ask for Brian!

resp.text:
Thanks so much for the kind review!
Means so much when a customer takes the time to complement us!
Much appreciated!!

resp.text: Thank you so very much Tracy for the kind review!!

name: Chontanee Combs
text: Best experience I’ve ever had with a furniture company! They met all my needs, and some!! Great place to shop and great people to do business with!

resp.text: Thank you so much for using us for all of your furniture needs! Most of all I greatly appreciate you taking time to share such kind words about our business. Thanks so much!

name: AJ
text: Still haven’t received my furniture and it’s been months. I understand the pandemic has slowed things down but it’s ridiculous. These people don’t even update you on the shipment, you’ll have to keep asking them yourself. Not a good look. If I paid in full for something you should be updating me frequently not the other way around. Won’t be shopping here again.

resp.text:
I am sorry that you feel we have not kept you informed more frequently about shipment dates.
I know we have spoke on several occasions, and emailed each other.
Every retail establishment in the country is having issues with receiving product in a timely manner. It is totally out of our control, and if we could change things we would.
Delivery ETA's change daily and weekly, and that is why we cannot truly set or promise delivery dates.
When we have spoken, I told you what it stated at that present time.
When we spoke later, and that date was different and longer it frustrated you more.
What you used to take 4-6 weeks has been now doubled. Sometimes it comes quicker which is a blessing. We take pride in Customer Service, and it is certainly not my intention to not properly inform you of shipment dates. We did provide you with a loaner while you wait which I do not believe any one else is doing.
My sincere apology if you felt like we have not provided you with the best service possible.

text: My wife dropped her Samsung S8+ phone and spider webbed her screen.  I had used CPR before but before the new owner bought the business about 3 years ago. I was called late that afternoon but chose to wait until the next day to pick it up.  It was like a brand new phone. Wife is happy, I am happy.  Great service, friendly competent employees, and a willingness to go the little bit extra that makes for great customer service.

Regular business hours they close at 8pm.  Modified hours right now, they actually closed at 6pm. I was upset and frustrated. Couldn't believe she didn't know when her own business closed!

name: CHRISTIANA BARKER-LEE
text: My phone had touch issues and CPR opened my device and as of right now it’s in working condition thanks to static removal. The owner Christi Russell didn’t even charge me. Love Christi for helping me

name: Brenda Abbott
text: Recommended to go here by Sprint to have a broken screen replaced.  Arrived at 4:30 pm to closed sign even though hours are posted until 6 pm.  Cristy let me in and stated they needed to order a new screen because she didn'thave the part in stock..  I was desperate so I paid half and was told it would be in Tuesday am.  Get a quote on Monday from another place for half what I was charged here.  I felt it was a lesson learned and at least I was supporting a local  business.   On Tuesday, screen has not come in.  Promises it will be there Wednesday.  When I call on Wednesday I get disconnected when I press 2 for store and pressing 3 to speak with Cristy and the mail box is full.  Cristy called me back telling me her credit card was compromised and the order was canceled.   She promises it will be in Thursday morning.  No call until Thursday  night at 5:30.  Cristy says she won't be there because it's Halloween but I can drop off my phone and pick it up if I want to come in.  Although I had plans for Halloween,  I cancel so I can get my phone  fixed.  It took longer than expected but was repaired and by looking at the reviews, I am lucky my phone  is working properly.  I was told I would receive a free screen protector but when I picked up my phone was told they didn't have any in stock.  Overall it was not a positive experience and I am pretty sure I paid a lot more than I should have.  I suggest reading the reviews and not just trusting a recommendation from a store or the star rating.  Sign in the store offers 10% off for good social media review.  I now wonder how many of these good reviews were authentic or written for a discount.

name: Christopher Walker
text:
1. The place stinks like a dirty ashtray when you walk in.
2. A disheveled employee approached me--he was polite--I'll give him that
3. I asked about a new screen for my iPhone 6S+
4. He said, "Wow, those are so new and hard to get. The screen alone will cost $299.00!"
4a.--The above is NOT true--the screen even at the most expensive offering is $180.
4b.--It is NOT hard to get
4c.--If you go to a true Apple store (i.e. Summit Birmingham)--they will replace your screen while you wait for $149.00. CPR with their prices could literally take your phone to B-ham and have lunch and still earn over $200 per phone (when you include labor). Wouldn't be surprised if that is what they do. The guy that waited on me knew the price at the Apple Store when I mentioned it. That is pure speculation on my part; but, this CPR place is a mess and totally unprofessional.

My advice--take a trip to the Apple Store (get an appointment first) and the folks there will make your phone like new for $149. The money you'll save will more than pay for the trip and you'll have enough left over to enjoy a nice lunch at all the great restaurants at "The Summit."

If you MUST get your phone repaired in Montgomery--I suggest "Total Cell Phone Repair." They charge parts + $55 labor--or $235. That's still expensive; but, at least they are honest on the price of the screen. CPR charges $299 JUST FOR THE SCREEN alone--Absolute "Rip-Off" If there labor charges are the same as most--$55.00/hour--that would be $350.00 price tag!!

name: Sam Caudill
text: I got a price that was equivalent to how much it should have coated to fix my Nexus 6 properly, which ran me $290 (big phone screen and nice glass, and $20 for a warranty to fix it if the screen breaks again which they said they wouldn't do after it broke) Except the problem is that the glass they replaced is not the same kind of glass the phone comes with. The glass broke from stress in my pocket while I was at work standing (I'm a cashier), and the phone continues to crack from just being set down. Honestly they did get it fixed properly but they didn't uphold their promise to make it "good as new". They overcharge for cheap glass so you may as well not fix your screen.

name: Foxx Hound
text:
New management which has a new Professional set up. Excellent customer service. Quality work. I Highly recommend.

Mike Grissom of Capitol Hyundai

name: Tori Jackson
text: Worst experience for the last few weeks.. I was told that I would have my iPhone back within 3 days and I have been dealing with CPR for about 3 to 4 week. Within these 3 to 4 weeks I have been more than 5 times and nothing was ever complete. when I got my phone back. My center button was perminately pressed in. So I called back (this should have never happened anyways) and told the guy what was up and we discussed me coming back on Monday (my ONLY off day) and the shop NEVER OPENED. nor was there even a number to leave a message. As a customer I feel this was disrespectful. Because not once was I called this time or the Times before to be told "I'm sorry your device is not ready or, your part didn't come in" anything to prevent me from driving all the way from where I live which is not in the city of Montgomery. The amount of gas that has gone though my car just traveling back and forth to this place is unspeakable.. Because the site  never opened Monday, I took the phone to another repair place only to be told "the hole for this phone is too small. This isn't the right screen." ... So, I paid over 100 dollars to be given back a phone that isn't properly fixed. how can you give a customer back a phone that isn't properly fixed and that's the whole point of the store. I feel like that is SO shady because I did my part. There is no way this couldn't have been seen. My phone stays on voice control constantly which is SO annoying and half the time I can't even control it. I want my money back.

name: Theresa Taylor
text: Workers are good at what they do. But it really took longer than really expected to fix phone due to being sent sub par part...not their fault. But it was a very expensive fix. But the work has done well.... And have not had any issues so far.

name: Bethany Deairy
text: Christi and her tech team show exemplary service! She does everything she can to help you and has you out in a timely manner.

name: Pre'Knechia Carter-Stokes
text:
One word, unprofessional.
My girlfriend and I went into this place expecting her iPhone 6 Plus to be fixed, it ultimately wasn't. We paid $220 and I also paid a rush fee for the screen to come in next day. It did come in next day but here is where the issue came ...
They "fixed" the screen but once my girlfriend got it to the car, the screen still wasn't working. They said it was a defective screen. OK fine, they order another. They put it on and it still doesn't work. I'm just thinking at this point that they don't know what they are doing. So they refund the rush fee. My girlfriend paid CASH to them for these repairs. She requests a refund and they only give her $130 one day and they said come back. Why ? We paid you cash the first time, why would we come back. She agrees and then we come back almost 3 days later asking for the remainder of the refund. He slings open the register and says, "I only have $50 you can either take this or come back." He said it like we were inconviencing him when we gave them three days to get cash. He offers to put the rest on the card, and this was Monday. It's now Thursday and no sign of the refund in sight. Don't go here. Please go to a certified Apple Specialist.

name: De'Shun Thrasher
text: Would rate them lower if I could. Got my cracked iPhone X screen repaired and it glitched the next day. They agreed that it was a fault in the screen but never ordered a replacement. Only lied and had me coming up there about 3 times a week. Also very quick to ignore phone calls once they see you have a problem that they're trying to dodge.

name: nerilis santiago
text: I went to your store on May 11, ordered the part, paid 50% and I was told that the was supposed to come in the next week. I went back a couple of weeks  later to told that the part was not in but in a couple of days they would have the part will be in and nothing. I called on June 6th and I was told that they were going to talk to the owner about it and call me back. He did called me back and told that the part is coming in the next day. That was on June 6. I was finally able to coming on June 17th just to find out that the still didn't have the part. I contacted the owner and she proceeded to text me, so I took it as her way for me to contact her. I send her a message trying to find a solution to this situation and the owner calls me back, tells me she didn't read my message and begins to yell at me and telling me all her  personal things. I tried to sympathize with her and she continued been rude and belligerent. She never gave me the opportunity to explained myself. She asked if I wanted the cellphone repair or my money back. I told her that I wanted my money back and she hang up. I contacted the store and told them my decision just for them call 20 minutes later and telling that they ordered the part. How am I supposed to still doing business with them when the owner, as she identified herself, treated a costumer in that way.

name: Comoletha Jamison
text: The owner Christie is a life saver, we had 4 devices down all in less than 3 days, and her and her crew fixed them ALL in less than 24 hours. Thanks love and look out for my family, friends, etc.

name: Marina Z
text: Great customer service. Very fast. Decent prices. Highly reccomend.

name: Tobi Wasden
text: Love It Everyone is nice and took great care of me and my phone. I recommend everyone who asks me if i know of a place to get my phone fixed i send them to CPR montgomery

name: Christi Russell
text: The best place in town! Their technicians are certified and friendly. Can have your device repaired in less than and hour if the part is in stock or by the next day if they have to order it.

name: John Eidsmoe
text: Courteous, knowledgeable, fixed my phone in a few short minutes.  Recommend highly!

name: Kwanesia Wright
text: Hit my phone on a chair at work and the screen goes out then black, blue, purple, green, and white. Screen is fudged...called and spoke with a representative and said I’ll be in on my lunch break. Long story short phone is working again

name: Amy Kim
text: the staff is very nice and it was ready quickly and the price was nice too

name: akersfam
text:
This business is awful and a rip off!!! Take your repair money to the Apple store or reputable shop! Overpriced, shoddy work by novices, super low quality repair parts, and their “warranty” claims are a total scam- YOU WILL pay twice to fix the unrepaired original problem!  We spent $130 on an iPad cracked screen repair.  When we received it back we had 3 new issues: off-center digitizer, inoperative digitizer and inoperative home key. Despite big talk about warranty, manager/owner Kristy blew us off on 5 separate attempts to allow them another repair opportunity, even with us having to pay again!

We paid another $100 to a reputable/professional repair shop, and repair was done flawlessly for less money. The new guy saved the home key to show us how jacked up the repair was,  and proved that the “damaged lcd” they contended was total BS (it works and looks beautiful now, and we did not replace the lcd!)

This IS NOT a reputable repair place. DO NOT trust them with anything other than a $10 phone screen protector replacement, and make them do the repair in your presence.

If this is the only scathing review here, feel free to disregard. But if this isn’t the only very poor review, then heed the warning and don’t go here. This outfit will be out of business within the year, all due to Kristy and her philosophy of ripping off and gouging hard working customers like you, and very likely worsening or ruining your expensive phone or tablet.

JM Akers

name: Donald Chavis (Bubba)
text:
Do not go between 3:30 and 5 pm. High traffic, low staff.
If Christi contacts you about purchasing your phone or equipment, make sure she knows exactly what you have. I drove there to sell my iPhone 5, after 40 mins of her testing my phone she realized it was not a 5s, my ad clearly stated my phone was a 5. I'm sorry does not replace your time or effort.
They do seem technically knowledgeable, but have not grasped the customer service aspect of the business yet.

name: Jennifer Pope
text: Fast and friendly service! I highly recommend.

name: Eden Thornton
text: Droid Moto Z Play needed new screen.  Went to pick up three different times.  Each time, there was a section of the screen that was not adhered properly.  Each time received a different excuse.  They finally fixed it and delivered it to my office on a Friday.  BTW, they put my SIM card in someone else's phone.  I had to spend an hour at Verizon having a new SIM card programmed.  Sorry Gold I-Phone 7 user, whose phone they placed my SIM card in.  It's my understanding that when we got the reprogrammed one, our old one, in your phone, quit working.  Hope you enjoyed your CPR experience as much as I did.  I gave it back to my child on Sunday evening.  He sat in the den and played on it.  By Monday evening the screen went blue / purple.  By Tuesday morning, it was solid black.  The phone is in an Otterbox with a screen protector and he literally did not leave the chair with it.  Now I am out $220 and have a phone that still does not work.

name: Melinda Laymon
text: Service was the best i have received in a long time and the technicians  were sure of what theyre doing .

name: Amelia Blackwood
text: Christi, CPR's owner, is incredibly personable, as is her entire team of IT professionals.  They truly know their products & programs when it comes to Apple iRipoff's (kidding, kind of) & Samsung. Repairs, sales, upgrades, etc - CPR is certified & completely competent to handle any & all of your IT needs at the most reasonable price username yet in Montgomery.

name: Gloria Sheldon
text: With trepidation I sent my iPad and Samsung cell phone in by a friend to CPR for repair expecting a costly fix and a long wait time. I usually incur long drives from the country or drive backs, long  wait times and unexpected additional cost for most everything. As promised the repairs were made promptly and inexpensively.  Moreover, everything works perfectly, was nicely cleaned and I received a new iPad holster free within an a couple hours including drive time.  Good job new management!

name: Jeff Grossman
text: Was quoted a price for my cell to sell to them since had a cracked screen etc.. But still a new galaxy 3 used 2 weeks... after beating down to almost nothing said heck with it cut him a deal to repair screen 200.00 bucks so agreed, then when asked to just transfer the minor pics etc... wanted to reduce selling price by 50%... little rude to boot.. left to think it over ( cool) off a little over the scam...Get back after removing and transfer data etc,,,. says still buy drive all the way back (Oh no money today)????? ok, be tomorrow ... drive all the way down AGAIN....OH NO MONEY TO BUY...Unreal... the young man taller guy less techno prepped was helpful and over all nice guy...derrick I think was the nut buster... other guy today cool...maybe other little one's rings..etc..mad him ill.... lol

name: kershondra dickerson
text: Fast nice service and great customer service. The owner is wonderful!!!

name: stephen price
text: Had a fantastic experience at Cell Phone Rehab. Christy, was very helpful and explained exactly what they could do to repair my iPad and how long it would take. Everyone was so helpful and courteous and great care was taken to repair my iPad as economically as possible. Would not hesitate to recommend Cell Phone Rehab to anyone in need of help getting their phone or iPad back up and running! Hands down the best place to go! You will not be disappointed!

name: Noah Cox
text: I had to wait 4 days and go in 4 different times just to get a battery replaced. Unprofessional and inexperienced staff. In the end I had to go somewhere else to get it fixed. Don't let them touch your phone.

name: David Kryger
text: Made my iPhone brand new. Quick service at a great price.

name: Jonathan Law
text:
Absolutely horrible, shockingly bad experience. I have never in my life dealt with such an unprofessional group of people. Before I brought my phone to these people, every single thing on it worked perfectly. The only issue I had is that there was a scratch on the left side of the screen that irritated me. So I tried to do the right thing and support a local business (or at least a business in the area). On August 5, 2015, I prepaid $161.49 for a screen and service for an iPhone 6. I was told that I would be notified when the parts arrived.

Days go by, and I don't hear from them. I had to call on the 11th and finally ask what exactly was going on. They had an excuse about how their delivery of parts was delayed. Either way, they'd have it the next day. So I'm pretty understanding, and I agree that'd be fine. I take the phone in on August 12. Again, they do not call me - I had to turn up and see whether it was done. I wait approximately 10 minutes after arriving since they were apparently still working on it. Everything looked good initially when I got it back, but I started noticing problems almost right away on the phone.

There was an absolutely immense battery drain on the phone, but more importantly than even that was the ambient light sensor not working, the backlighting at the top of the phone was WAY off, (and they should have noticed that if nothing else if they repair phones for a living) and the proximity sensor wasn't working. If you don't know what a proximity sensor is, when you hold a smartphone up to your head to talk, it shuts the screen off so it doesn't register contact with the screen. It makes it very difficult to use your phone as a phone when it isn't working. The next day, on August 13, I call them back and explain the issue. They agree to take a look at it again and see if there's something they missed. I understand that sometimes, these things happen.

Can't make it there before close on August 14, but I do arrive on August 15th. Another employee looks at the phone, and says that there's just an issue with the screen at this point. They'll have to order another screen to resolve these issues. It's frustrating, but I understand, and I agree, and ask them to contact me when it is in. I waited 10 days, and heard nothing from them. Called a little late in the day on August 25th, and I was told that they got the part in either the day before or that day. So, I mean, thanks for the heads up, right? Can't make it there that day, so I take it in on August 26th.

On August 26th, I drop the phone off yet again around 12:00. The employee says they're a little backed up, but they should hopefully have it ready in about 2 1/2 hours. I told him it was fine. Close to that time later, I got a call saying the screen was on the phone, and they were going to test the other functions. Got another call later, and they told me that the screen was working fine, but that they could not get the proximity sensor to work. They claimed to have tested different parts, but they simply could not get the proximity sensor to work on the phone. I asked how we intended to resolve this issue, especially since it worked when I brought it to them.

I was told that they could either place a damaged screen on the phone (not my original screen in this case, but one that was much, much more damaged) and get a refund, or that basically, I'd have to live with it. This is literally three weeks to this point, and I absolutely need that telephone. Time I don't have it almost always translates to lost productivity. So essentially, my choice was to get my phone back in worse shape than I brought it in, and get my money back, or to keep the screen and they don't fix an issue they caused. I essentially had no real choice in the matter. I am contacting my credit card company to get my money back. They are a terrible business, and your money would be better spent anywhere else. They should be ashamed, but they're not.

name: Tyler Barranco
text: Phone didn't react to touch or swiping motion. Once I brought it to CPR it worked good as new!

name: Andres Macias
text: My IPhone 6 wasn't charging, they cleaned the charge port in less than 5 min. Good As New

resp.text: Thank you for your review. We are glad to hear you enjoyed your visit with us!!!

text: Bad

text:
(Translated by Google) Very good service and very fast I recommend them and above all the kindness of the staff 👍👏

(Original)
Muy buen servicio y muy rápido se los recomiendo y sobre todo la amabilidad del personal 👍👏

text:
(Translated by Google) They provide good customer service and low prices with good quality.

(Original)
Prestan un buen servicio de atención al cliente  y bajos precios con buena calidad.

name: Qingfeng Chen
text:
(Translated by Google) I am replacing my mobile phone battery, the battery performance is good, the only drawback is that the charging speed is slower.

(Original)
我在更换了我的手机电池，电池的性能不错，唯一缺点就是冲电速度比较慢点。

name: Ginger Lewis
text: I pick up Wish orders here sometimes. The owners are super friendly. The wife makes jewelry from some of the parts from inside old computers! Very unique and very affordable! Lots of extras in this hidden gem! 😉

name: Mary Moore
text:
I brought in my Dell laptop as I could not get it out of an "infinite boot loop" or "infinite restart." I ended up getting a new laptop and a data transfer. I interacted with all three team members listed on the site and they were all friendly and professional. The building is clean and organized.

However, I dropped it off at noon on a Thursday for it to be tested as they believed it was something else. The receipt/contract sheet I was given said 1-2 business days, but it ended up being 7 before they got to my computer, not counting Sunday. By this point I had already purchased a new laptop and decided I just wanted a data transfer. This was my first time using this business so I have no idea if this is indicative of the average wait period. I know they experienced property damage recently due to the snow storm and I would imagine that would set their workflow back a good bit. I like to give people the benefit of doubt.

They also sell a wide variety of new and used electronic products and when I went in the first time they even had a lot of unrelated merchandise jewelry, stickers, etc.

4/5 overall good experience. I normally don't leave reviews but I was impressed enough by this.

name: Jarmarcus Lewis
text: Tervor was very condescending with his remarks about my role as a customer. I did not feel that he valued my business. He offered other places that I take my business instead of assuring that my product would be repaired in the timely manner. I am sure that Tervor will not miss my one repair job, and his business will continue on.  However, ever customer is important to some businesses and I will spend my money at them.

resp.text:
My grandfather had a saying, "when you tell half truths, you deal in all lies."

I did call you, left a voicemail, saying that I didnt appreciate the way you spoke with my staff, and that your system had been here only 8 Business Days, when the repair time clearly posted at time of drop off was 10 business days. I told you that based on that you would have your system with Saturday or Monday, but in your review you state I didn't assure you when it would be repaired "in a timely manner", however I did tell you when, and it was timely based on the posted repair wait at time of drop off.

You state I offered other places, that is possibly the only true part of your review. I offered the other places around that could get to your repair if the wait wasn't doable for you.

You stated you was a "manager of a big box store" and that you "worked for AT&T" and that you don't treat a customer like this. To which I informed you I was "not a big box store, and I wouldn't let anyone treat my employee's wrongly."

Upon further looking into this, another lie came out. You are not a manager at AT&T, just a sales person. I know this, cause our business has over 55 lines with AT&T.

I hope you take this opportunity to learn to treat people the way you want to be treated, cause if you treat my staff improperly, I will call you out.

name: Barry Reding
text: My son took his computer to these people last Saturday. The technician told him the problem was most likely to he power supply and showed him the power supply that was needed. My son saw the price tag on the power supply read $80. Today (Wednesday) at 3pm my son went to pick up the computer because they hadn’t fixed it. They require a $35 deposit and would not give him the money back because it is non refundable. They did no work to the computer. I found this shady to say the least given the fact they did no work. I called and after being passed off to four different people I questioned the deposit. I was told by all four people that the deposit was necessary because people bring their computers there and never come to pick them up. I pointed out that was not the case here. I then asked if I could come there and purchase the power supply for $80 minus the $35 that had already been paid. At first the answer was yes you can do that but we won’t guarantee the part. I said I was fine with that. As the conversation progressed and I pressed for a solid answer on the purchase person number four (apparently the top of the ladder there) he began to to fish tail. He said power supplies can range in price. I reminded him the technician actually showed the power supply to my son that was needed for his computer. The price tag said $80. He said you can bring the computer back and we will look at it before the EOB today. At this point I wouldn’t trust these people to hold a penny. Person number four hung up me. It’s a scam. Stay away from these people.

resp.text:
Your system was dropped off on Saturday.  There is a sign clearly posted that it is currently 3 business days before a technician gets to your repair.  You choose to come pick up your system before the technician got to it on the 3rd business day (it was the next item on his list to work on for the record).  You spoke with 3 separate people when you asked for a refund on the non-refundable deposit every customer pays at drop off.  All 3 offered to have you bring the system back with no additional deposit for the technician to work on the system.  The technician even offered to work on the system immediately if you brought it back in today.  You refused.  One of the owners agreed to your request that the deposit be applied to purchase of a power supply, even though there is no verification that a power supply will fix the system.  This did not satisfy you either.  Services have been offered multiple times.  The bench fee is clearly covered at drop off and with signs on the counter at drop off.  If you had chosen to bring the system back, the $35 bench fee would be applied to your over all bill.  No one from our store told you to come pick up your system, what was wrong with it, or that we could not fix it.  We still offered you services that you choose to refuse.

The offers were made by multiple employees as well as one of the owners. All calls are recorded and the offers were recorded as well. The security video and audio is available upon request. And the offer still stands, you are welcome to bring it back in or apply the deposit to anything in store, same as owner offered on phone.

name: Addison Pace
text: The Next Generation Staff is fantastic! They are always helpful, professional, and honest! I’ve bought computers from and sold computers to Trevor and each experience has been great. Additionally, they will do everything in their power to make sure that you get a great deal, love your products, and receive excellent customer service. I will never go anywhere else!

resp.text:
Thank you so much! We try to have the product selection you would expect in large stores, with the knowledge you would expect from IT departments in large corporations,  and the friendliness you would find in the small "mom and pop" stores of yester-year.

We strive for 100% satisfaction from every client, at every interaction.  We want you to become family, and I hope you feel you have.

Thank you for your trust and support! One day, maybe, you will get to teach one of our little ones in high school!

name: Flea Bag
text: Came in today because my PC would not POST. The guys there were very friendly, professional, knowledgeable, and had an eagerness to figure out the problem. My PC was quickly fixed, even had its cables managed for me, and I had a great experience! I definitely now know the place I will always go and recommend to my friends. 10/10

resp.text: Thank you so much for the opportunity to help you out! We enjoy making our customers happy, making sure things are done properly, and making sure our customers are running at full capacity.  Thank you again!

name: Colleen Beahm
text: Very helpful. You can drop off old computers to be recycled there.

name: William Bishop
text: Great service and very friendly employees. They fixing my laptop quick and the cost was inexpensive.

name: Randall's Collision
text: Excellent technicians, excellent products.  Always there when we need them.

name: Debbie Pesta
text: They are very kind and helpful, she went beyond what she needed to do to help me. I will go back.

name: Roger M
text: We had or server go down due to a power supply fault. I took the unit to them and they quickly replaced the power supply and we were up an running within 2 hours. Once it was fixed we were able to make bills and continue shipping all with minimal down time. That says allot. Great job!

resp.text: Thank you Roger! We hope you are happy with everything.  If we can help you let us know. Trevor said he will be responding that email later today.

name: Mark Derwin
text: Not too many computers

resp.text: We are currently working to improve our stock, however,  with the nationwide shortage of microprocessors, resulting in  outrageous prices of graphics cards, it us hard for a small business to keep a large inventory.  Sorry for the inconvenience.

name: Serena you
text: I drive from tupelo mississippi to do business with this family,  they are friendly,  helpful,  kind, hardworking,  very VERY knowledgeable and professional,  and a pleasure to do business with. Also very VERY big on answering any questions in a fast and timely manner,  and after care is fantastic!!!

resp.text: Thank you so much, Serena!  We love our customers and strive to offer the best service possible.

name: Malcolm Jelks
text: Great people .Every time we need something They come right out to our shop and take care of us  . far better price than anyone else

resp.text: Thank you, Malcolm!  We appreciate it.  We enjoy working with y'all.

name: Aaron Lindsey
text: Would not recommend them. I called to see about having them build a gaming pc for me. I was having to wait for the funds but figured why not touch base & see if this was something they could do. He said he could. A week later I called back to schedule an appointment for going over what I wanted in the build. I told the person on the phone I had talked with Trevor about it last week and now have the funds for the build. She rudely told me i needed to schedule an appointment. I thought to myself does this person not understand that's what I'm trying to do? I just said nevermind I will order one on the net. Which I did through iBuyPower.com They lost business because of the bad attitude of the person who answered the phone They gave off a better than you attitude. I honestly wanted to use a local business to help the area economy during the Covid-19 pandemic. To bad I didn't get to

resp.text:
Aaron, this is Trevor.  I attempted to contact you after you spoke to Lakin via facebook, never did anyone, other than myself speak to you over the phone. You blocked our business account and wouldnt answer personal messages. I have screenshots and will be glad to send them to you.

The person you talked to on Facebook didnt know you wanted to set up and appointment and was suggesting you did. She had not been the one dealing with you and didnt know we had talked.

We attempted to contact you several times to fix this and you wouldnt respond,  and blocked the message where I was talking to you.

I am sorry you feel she was rude, however she didnt know and was suggesting an appointment to save you time. Please check your messages as you can see I personally tried to talk to you.

name: Harold Brock
text: Worst experience at a computer store ever!

resp.text:
We apologize to Mr. Brock that he didn't understand we couldn't purchase an item he brought in without proper documentation. After it was provided we paid him in full the agreed amount.

Later we were forced to no trespass the customer and file police reports due to continued harassment and threats.

We strive to earn a good review always, but sometimes it is impossible. We can not purchase good without proper ID to make sure devices are not stolen.

name: Chris Royster
text: Great service and friendly atmosphere. They are very helpful.

resp.text: We are always happy to help you Chris, even if it to give you bad news that your phone is dead. Thank you for your continued support!

name: Mike Parker
text: Great job on the PS4.......Thanks Alot !!!

name: Allison England
text: Stay Away, I took my repair in over 2 months ago. He told me parts are over seas. He is never open, does not answer the phone, ignores my calls. Thief!

resp.text:
We apologize that you feel we could do something to get parts here faster. Due to the COVID19 Pandemic, lock downs, and shutdowns in our Country as well as in many companies’ factories are in, such as China and Japan, parts have become hard to get. When they do arrive, they must clear customs. Normal shipping from overseas is 2-4 weeks, without any delays. We work as hard as possible to keep our customers happy, however some things are out of our control. Shipping is one.

As far as phone calls, our office is manned Mon-Fri 9AM-6PM, there is an auto attendant and Voice Mail should we be on other line. We also have email available on our drop off forms for customers to contact. If you have any questions please email me at info@nextgencomputers.net.

Please also give me the name your repair is registered in, as we do not have anything in the name "Allison England" and I will be glad to look into why it took so long.

name: Brad Davidson
text: Children in business! unprofessional,

We are a small business that is FAMILY owned. With the current COVID19 crisis there is no other options if we want to work than to bring our children to our office. Furthermore, we believe it is important to instill in them a good work ethic so they can learn they have to work for what they want, and not expect it to be handed to them.

Our technicians are 100% certified, and as such, all adults. Children being here doesn't change our business practices or our ability to serve clients. It only shows the world, what a TRUE family owned business is!

name: V Veckio
text:
Warning: Shady practice with possible scams.

I identified to "Dr. Computer" that my PC had been infected with malware and expressed the concern that my BIOs was also affected which was used as a ploy against me. After leaving my PC at his house, some 30+ minutes later I received a phone call from him telling me that the BIOs password was not working and was incorrect of which I attested that it was correct. I turn around and go back to his house to try my password and upon the screen was an enter password prompt which was not my BIOs password prompt.

He was running a bootable USB connected to my device (of which I was presently unaware) as a ploy that my BIOs was locked and essentially bricked. Upon him making a few statements that my PC was useless now (any proper computer geek would know otherwise) I decided to take my leave *WITH* my computer. I'm not sure if he was expecting me to just leave it, offer to sell it to him or charge me surplus to fix the imaginary problem.

On my way home I pondered over this quite a bit and was very worried that he installed something that would prevent me accessing it. I'm also worried that whatever program he was running from the USB recorded my attempted passwords. When I arrive home I immediately plug in my PC in a network isolated environment and the computer boots as normal into the actual BIOs with my BIOs password working as expected. I am very thankful that he did not change the actual BIOs password and truly brick my motherboard.

Whatever rogue program he showed me and tried to convince me that this was my BIOs password prompt is non-existent on my computer. Also to note, I don't think I will be able to respond to whatever he says towards this review because of how the reviews here work. No matter what response he has, the man isn't as knowledgeable about computers as he purports or thinks. I'm sure he gets away with stuff like this all the time from people that aren't very tech savvy.

If you really want a trustworthy computer repair, send it in to a legit tech company.

name: Clever Witticism Here
text: My laptop had a noisy fan for a few weeks. The technician "fixed" it in about two hours; however, when I got it home it would no longer power on. I returned the following day to have them look at  it, but they wanted to charge me an additional fee. I declined to pay again. I then asked for a refund of my previous payment. They refused to return my money. So yeah, I gave them $82.50 to break my laptop even worse than it already was.

resp.text: We cant satisfy every customer and when he  left our shop the computer was working fine and had it not been he wouldn't have signed off on the work order and paid his fee. which every customer  does before and after,  if they so chose  to but fair and honest  he saw his unit working prior to him leaving our shop and   was satisfied, and  had it for a few days using it without issue,  when he finally sent it back by his friend who said it wasn't powering on. winch had nothing to do with us replacing his fan.  (which was working and cooling when  he picked it up) i am assuming that from him running it so long without any regard for the fan being bad and not cooling that it compromised the integrity of his CPU and  it finally failed do to it being run so long without a proper cooling fan, which there is no way to actually know how long he ran it prior to seeking us out  and replacing it was to little to late. they are not meant to run  contentiously under those conditions something is eventually going to fail. but to make the accusations he did which is slander and misrepresentation of our professional service. i need not say anymore. but in  to set the record straight the service for which  we were hired was performed correctly and professionally the fact that he had an underlying issue was not something he cared to talk about or get into and was strictly adamant. that he didn't care to spend anything over the fee.

text: I was a victim of a vicious internet scam in which the perpetrator locked me out of my laptop.  I called Microsoft Tech Support and they tried to resolve the issue but they couldn't via telephone.  I needed to get my computer fixed ASAP so I searched the internet and saw Dr. Computer (Wesley).  After a brief conversation, he asked that I drop off the computer.  When I dropped off the computer, Mr. Wesley recommended that I return two hours later for pick up.  Two hours later, my computer was unlocked, my files were recovered and the system ran better than before.  He fixed my computer in 2 hours for $75 which was a fraction of what the Microsoft Tech Support intended to charge.  Mr. Wesley knows his stuff; he is an excellent computer repair tech.  I strongly recommend him for any of your computer repair needs.  The dude is really good at what he does.  I hope he keeps up the GREAT work!!!!!

name: Brigitte polk
text: Dropped my computer off, charging port was not keeping a charge. Told me he could not fix it! Did not tell me he tried to solderize the port and did a horrific job. Short circuited my mother board. I had to take it to professionals and cost was $700 because of Mr.Computer’s mess, instead of the $160 cost to fix the charging port. He never called me back or took responsibility for his mess up! I keep the charger port he so badly soldered to remind me to always take your items to reputable organizations that stand behind their work and or mess ups!!!

resp.text:
reviews are wonderful things when used properly and  for the right reasons  i recall this  persons laptop and i mentioned to her prior to  taking her unit in that depending on the  damage  and  the severity of it , meaning if it was severed from the board it self  or if the board had  suffered damage or had a crack  or fracture in that location , those things would  factor into whether that  job could and should be done. now with that being said  and i try and do honest work and  i will not damage or take in any job that i cant perform . i told her upon her retrieving her unit that there was nothing  that could be done. the damage was in such a manner that soldering it would not have done it any good. and i let her know this. and  i think its strange that her price isn't something we normally charge for that type of work. it is easier to refuse a job than take one that is not repairable and i do this  because i love it not because i need to i have met  allot of people  in my 20 plus years doing this and its those people that keep me turning screws and showing up daily. i will not speak against her  because that is  not the kind of man i am  but honesty and integrity mean allot to me and my reputation means more to me than any amount of money i could ever make doing this. my previous reviews speak for me and my work ethic and the honor i place in serving each and everyone of you. with that being said i always respond to all my calls and  i don`t leave anyone  out and had it been something  that was done  in my care i would have gladly given her a replacement and or made it right had it been brought to my attention. i give laptops away  all the time depending on the circumstances and the need. i posted this response because i was asked to not because i felt i had to William Shakespeare said it best ..
Good name in man and woman, dear my lord,
Is the immediate jewel of their souls:
Who steals my purse steals trash; 'tis something, nothing;
'Twas mine, 'tis his, and has been slave to thousands;
But he that filches from me my good name
Robs me of that which not enriches him
And makes me poor indeed.
—William Shakespeare

text:
I’m a middle school teacher and writer who tries heavily on my computer for work. My charging port was damaged and was melting charger tips, and only worked if I positioned the charging cord just so, usually with the tip supported by a pen or book on my desk. I had it repaired before at a since closed establishment that did what can only be described as a hack job. Because of these things I was extremely picky about where to take my business, and was checking the reviews for all local computer repair shops when I found this business.

Not only did they fix my computer in less than 24 hours, they listened to my concerns and explained what they would do to prevent the charging port coming loose again. The customer service was fantastic, the repair was perfect, and I cannot recommend this business enough. Their prices are extremely fair, especially considering the quality of service and repair, and the turnaround time made the price even more worth it.

Thank you so much!

text: I called Tyler and his team from Florida service my 87-year-old mother's desktop in Montgomery. We caught it in time.  Tyler installed some security software.  All for I thought was a ridiculously low price.  Thank you so much. Before I went to Tuscaloosa Wireless, I had first actually went to Best buy Geek squad, they just checked to see if my charger was ok. Once it was confirmed that the charger was fine but the laptop was not starting they just concluded that the motherboard must be having a problem and that it was probably not even worth the cost to fix it. They didn't have a technician on site to even try to transfer the info from the motherboard and the lead time to do anything was 2-3 days.

I am not from Alabama and was just visiting the area when all this occurred. I am very lucky that I found Tuscaloosa Wireless. And a Big Thank you to Chico to diagnose and fix the issue in a timely and cost effective manner. Thank you :)

name: Sayres Harbin
text:
I came back from a trip and found my computer power supply had shorted out. This  caused the motherboard to also fry.I decided to take my desktop to Dan for him to inspect. Dans conclusion really pissed me off. Dan wanted me to scrap the entire thing TO HIM (for free) and back up my files on one of his external hard-drives. Then he wanted me to buy one of his Franken-computers he had in the back. The funny thing is, I'm well aware of the parts in my computer and some are relatively new parts. I decided to get my documents backed up on MY external hard-drive and bid him adieu. He wouldn't take no for an answer and ended overcharged me for this process ($90 for a backup WOW). Also, it might be a clear indicator of what type of business this man runs when he charges someone full price for parts labeled "good" or "bad" from his shelf of scrapped parts. His external hard-drives are also overpriced and outdated in my opinion. I got mine at Wal-mart for less and at least it was made in this decade.

I would advise anyone to not use this business at least for repair. Dan is well aware of what he is doing. It might be more expensive to get a Geek Squad membership but at least they will give you proper business and advice.

name: Drew West
text: Excellent service! I highly recommend these guys.

name: The RC1
text:
I took my laptop into Dan after spilling some water under it and causing enough damage for it not to work.  He looked at it and took some of it apart and told me a memory card was messed up and he thought the motherboard was bad.  He proceeded to give me an estimate of up to $300 and told me he would ship it off to a company in San Diego he works with and they could fix it and it should be ready in two weeks.  He also told me my computer was under warranty which i was aware of but clearly spilling water on your computer is a breach of warranty so he told me if money was an issue to lie to dell and try to get them to fix it for free, i told him i did not want to do that so i gave it to him to fix. He made me put down a $100 deposit which he said consisted of $30 of shipping each way, which immediately confused me because my laptop weighs maybe 2 pounds, and $40 of labor on his part.  Reluctantly i did.

2 weeks later
I get a call from dell telling me to go pick up my laptop from the technician and ship it to them to fix it  for free.  So i go to Dan and he tells me he never sent my laptop off (so he has been sitting on it for 2 weeks and didn't tell me anything about a change of plans) and he looked at the back and saw it was under warranty (Duh, i know. but i breached the warranty).  He then proceeded to tell me he tried to call dell and get them to fix it and talked to them about it and they told him it was a bad motherboard.  They wouldn't let him ship it to them because he doesn't own the laptop.  I tell him to just give me the laptop and ill ship it to them (because i don't want it back in the slow ass amount of time he does things in). He gives me the laptop and i ask about the $100 deposit.  He says he has already spent wayyy to much time on it and says i'm lucky he didn't charge me more.  !!!( He charged me $100 to look at my computer for 20 minutes and then talk to dell on the phone for 1 hour, which i did not pay him to do, nor did he ask me before he did)!!! so i get my laptop and leave hoping to never deal with this individual again.

!!Read This!!
I give my laptop to dell and get it fixed for less than he quoted me and they get it back to me in 10 days.  I still had to go through the entire troubleshooting process with dell which took 1 hour 15 minutes on the phone which Dan said he did for me. At no point did they mention a motherboard.  Actually at no point did they predict any problems.  The problem was a hard drive and the memory.

An educated guess
I personally think Dan was trying to get my laptop fixed for free by Dell and then tell me he fixed it and charge me out the ass for fixing it, do i know this? no. Maybe he is just extremely incompetent at guessing problems.

Conclusion
Terrible experience, treated me like an idiot, slow, rip off, DO NOT USE
