name: Drew Mcdonald
text:
I had a problem with my computer hinge. Basically it broke off of the backing. Well I've been staying with my grandparents for the summer and I had no idea where to go. I got a recommendation to go to Bisdex. I took the computer in and right away he started pulling the front off of the computer. To me it seemed like he didn't really know what he was doing because once he pulled it off he said he needed to wait for a guy named taylor to come and do the work.I left the computer with him expected he knew what he was doing.

Well about 4 hours later he calls me and says there is good news and bad news. He says we may have fixed your hinge but your screen is not working. So I ask him "Ok well what can you do to fix it?" He tells me that he can't. At that point i'm upset because I had a perfectly good computer(An HP Pavilion m6 with beats audio) aside from a broken hinge and he broke the screen. He tells me that he's not responsible for the broken screen and says that he can sell me a new computer. Well I told Dan that i'm upset because he broke the screen. Well he hung up on me. I called back and his rudeness just got worse. Well in the end he fixed the screen, the hinge is still broken and all in all the computer has some other cosmetic issues that it did not have before. NEVER USE BISDEX!

name: Timothy Keele
text:
Dan was unprofessional and condescending.  I got my laptop second hand at a great discount, because it was a model made with weak hinges, causing the previous owner to have the screen replaced after an accident.  After I dropped it a short distance on its hinge, the display ceased to work, even though the rest of the laptop's functionality was normal.  I figured that it was a pretty open-and-shut loose wire problem, and that it would help to tell Dan these things when I arrived.

However, when I brought the laptop in, I accidentally grabbed the wrong, but near identical charger.  After he learned I brought the wrong charger, he treated me like a complete idiot, and disputed most anything I had to say.  The laptop's power button was flashing the 'low battery' pattern that I recognize, because Alienware laptops have highly customize-able lights.  Dan insisted that he couldn't do anything until I brought the proper charger in, because the laptop could have been flashing an error code, possibly indicating a software issue.  I was ready to fetch the proper charger, but wanted to leave the laptop with him while I did, explaining that I recognized the pattern and it was probably a hardware issue similar to the one it had before.  However, he pressed upon me that it was likely a software issue, 'proving' this by hooking it up to a monitor by VGA, and getting no response.  My laptop has never allowed the shortcut keys on my laptop to reroute the display until I got past the login screen, which we obviously couldn't do without a display, so this was a pretty irritating response.

He then repeated his point about the potential of an error code in the flashing power button light several times, using increasingly smaller words each time, and gave me a little diatribe on the importance of bringing a charger with you when you get a laptop repaired, a point that I had already raised, apologized for, and was so blindsightingly obvious as to be insulting.  After the fifth iteration of the 'error code' talk, we left.

TLDR;
The problem was a loose connection, and took another business less than half an hour to fix.  In the same amount of time, Dan had unsuccessfully plugged in a VGA cable, explained to me the importance of chargers and batteries, misidentified the problem, and ignored anything I had to say about the origin of the problem and the way my laptop worked.  At least he didn't try to charge me as I left.

name: Jasmyne “FatGirlish” bay
text: I had a netbook, the very very laptop, I took it to this company after reading these "great reviews".... I get to the store the man took very long to come from the back I stood alone and waited for about 5 mintues wondering was anyone there. Once he came up he seemed very nice, he looked at my laptop and gave me an estimate for my laptop. it was a bit pricey(broke college student budget), he then told me "wait lets try to work something out", so I listen to his proposal he dropped the price down a good bit for me, told me he needed a deposit to go ahead and order my screen, I was hesitant but since there a much needed thesis on my laptop and I didn;t have time on myside, we both agreed on the lower price(I didn't realize till later on the agreement he had wrote down 3 prices for "labor" he talked over that bit of info), I didn't get my laptop for days later(he told me it wld be ready in 2). Once i get there he was talking to another customer for 20min while I waited. He went to get my laptop, and i see the invoice had a whole new price, his labor had went up .  He could have explained how his price could go up , or gave me range that the price may be. I had to ask my father for the money just to get my laptop out. I couldn't believe I was leaving feeling ripped off ...Yes my laptop got fixed,bt I just felt the need to rate and comment from my experience.

name: Patsy Canty
text: Paid for original iPhone 11 screen and come to find out when the new update installed my Face ID doesn’t work. Took it to the apple store and verified the screen was not original but generic 🤬. I will be reporting to Better Business!!!!!! College students beware

resp.text:
Dear customer,

I’m sorry to hear about your disappointment, we repair screens on cellular phones according to the customer’s request, we carry the OEM original led screens and the high copy screens that cost less. The OEM original copy we work with, offers you lifetime warranty from the manufacturer.

Apple stores of course know the difference since they are the only ones authorized to replace the Apple original screens and they know when you fix it somewhere else, they care about it because you didn’t fix it with them. As a retail store we put our stamp behind the screen to validate the manufacturer warranty and when Apple stores see our stamp they will tell you that it is not their screen.

Please come back to our shop and give us the opportunity to test your device and validate the warranty we offer you. This will not cost you anything and we will check the reason why your Face ID is not working properly, also we would like to know the location where your device was fixed and when it was fixed.

We like to share with you that our goal is not just to repair devices, it is to make sure you are satisfied with our service by doing it right and keep our customers happy because we care about all of you. Every day we try our best to satisfy our customers as we stand behind our repairs. As I mentioned before we will take care of your device and will make sure you have the OEM original led screen and as I said it already you don’t have to worry about it, it is under warranty and we will do our best to make you satisfied.

Please email me for future questions or concerns at Tuscaloosawireless@gmail.com

Sincerely,

Store manager, Abe.

name: Nicole Boonin
text: These guys are so sweet. My screen cracked and they did everything they could to get the part for me as soon as possible, and since it was going to take a few days, they lent me a phone to use while they were repairing it! I haven't met one place that does that for you. Thanks for all the help, guys!

resp.text: It was our pleasure, Nicole. We can never replace your phone, but I'm glad to hear that you weren't phoneless during the time of your repair. Thank you so much for you review! -Elizabeth, General Manager

name: Sam Sepulveda
text:
Probably the worse customer service I have ever received.  I took in a tablet with a cracked screen.  They told me it should only be 4 days as long as the parts came in quickly. They ordered the wrong part not once, not twice, not even three times, it took them four (4) times to get the right part in.  I had to call and came into their shop almost every week to find out a status.  Every time I went in, I was told someone else was working on my tablet, but the tech would call me that night to update what was going on.  I never received one phone call from any tech.
Something that was suppose to take 4 days took over 30 days!  When I took the unit home, the pen was missing, which they still have not replace.  Immediately the tables starting ghosting. I had to bring it back and they said it was loose wires.  Even now, the tablet is not working properly, but I would rather deal with the tablet than these guys.
I talked to the owner and told him exactly what happened and he only said he was sorry and their techs needed to work on their customer service!
I will never take anything back to these guys!  I cannot and will not recommend these guys to anyone!

resp.text: I'm incredibly disappointed to read this, Sam -- I can only imagine how frustrating this must have been. Rest assured. I'll look into this immediately to see what happened and how we can prevent this in the future. It's thanks to honest feedback like yours that we can continue to grow and improve our service, so I appreciate​ you reaching out about your experience. I hope we'll get the chance to show you just how we're putting your input into practice someday. -Elizabeth, General Manager

name: Aubrey Rogers
text: I asked to have the charge port on my tablet replaced. They told me the part would arrive within a few days and the work would take a few hours. Three weeks later they still didn't have the part in. I called them 3 times in three weeks to see if my tablet was ready, each time they said they still had not received the part and they would call me in a couple days. They never called me. Yesterday once again I called to see if it was ready, again they said no. I told the general manager I was tired of waiting, cancel my order, I'm coming to get my tablet. I got busy and wasn't able to pick it up till today. When I got there and asked for my device the general manager said they finally got the part in after I had called yesterday, and they installed it. How convenient that the part finally came in mere hours after I said I'm tired of waiting, cancel my order. I paid for the cost of the part and left with a tablet that still won't take a charge. I've been so busy and tired, it didn't occur to me till tonight that I told them to cancel my order and they still installed the part anyway, which didn't even fix the problem, AND I paid for it.

name: Dorothy Patrick
text:
I took my Nexus 7 Tablet to have them look at it because it would not keep a charge. After 1 week I got it back fully charge and only spent $40.. the other guys up the street Phone Medic look at it charge me $20 and said it could not be fixed.
Thanks again..

resp.text: Dorothy, I just wanted to thank you for this review. I'm glad that our team could repair your Nexus 7 tablet for an affordable price. Please don't hesitate to give us a call or to stop by if you need our assistance again. - Elizabeth, General Manager

text: Must be the same experience for all of us!  I needed an iPad screen replaced, paid up front, was supposed to be a few days.  Weeks later...same boat.  Called 3 times now, left 2 messages, no return call.  Customer service is poor.  Service is poor. I'll upgrade to a 2 for now. They were very personable, but when I went by no one was at the store and they had no signs and when I called they didn't have my iPad. But they did bring it to me the following day... So that was good.

name: Maria McBryde
text: Horrible customer service. They said they ordered a screen to repair my broken one, but on the day the screen was to arrive, they had absolutely no record of the location of the screen or even if it had been ordered. They then said it would take one more day, and when I asked the next day, they said three more days. It's been a week of "just a few more days" and still no screen. Steven M, their technician, cannot tell the location of the screen, or even if it has been ordered (even though he supposedly placed the order). Steven doesn't seem terribly concerned about checking the status until I show up in front of him. There is no response to my texts and certainly no pro-active checking on his part. Today I decided that if they cannot even tell whether a part has been ordered or where it is, then they certainly cannot be trusted to actually perform a repair. On top of that, I just realized looking at the receipt that they have listed the wrong model for my phone! I would not recommend this company at all.

resp.text:
Hello Maria,

Please allow me to apologize for the negative experiences you have encountered with our Harbert location. It is never our intention to misquote a repair time, and I am very sorry that we have fallen short of your expectations. If there is anything that we can do to improve your experience with us, our Customer Support team would love to know! At your earliest convenience, please reach out to them at (877)320-2237 Monday through Saturday 10AM to 10PM and Sunday 12PM to 8PM EST. Thank you and we look forward to hearing from you.

text:
Took my computerintogetthekeyboard replaced.The person that helped me was very nice and estimated $30 for labor. They had it almost a month. WhenIwenttopickitup,I wascharged$90 for labor andtoldthatitwasmissingscrews. I knew the screw was missing on the left side only andpointeditoutwhenI dropped itoff. The person lost the other one. Asyou cansee,the (to make this readable, I had to go in and manually add spaces between all the words.The newkeyboard's space baronly works when it wants to. This means my job(transcription/translating/editing) takesalmosttwice as long.TheguyI pickedup thecomputerfromsaidthat he"updatedWindows and didn'tchargeme." I could havedonethat.Ialso couldhavereplacedmy ownkeyboard,butwaswillingtopay $30+costofpartfor theconvenience.I wasNOT CONTACTED beforehand to getconsent to proceed. Iwould have said no and gottenmy computerandthe keyboardandreplaceditmyself.I definitely felt taken advantageof(as awomanassumedtohavezero tech savvy- a real feeling of 'how much BS can I say to get her to pay3xthe estimate that she never consented to. I asked why they didn't call for consent and he hemmed and hawed.). There is a similar review down below with almost the exact same numbers, also from a female.

Also, the screen isnowstarting to detach fromthelostscrew andtherearedents inthe casingthatweredefinitely nottherewhenIdroppeditoff.

text: I called to see if they could help with my MacBookAir.  He talked me through some troubleshooting over the phone and the problem was resolved!  I will probably be using them to help me optimize storage this week so stay tuned!  BUT....very willing to help over the phone,

name: Russ Garcia
text: Bad experience - took my laptop in for a vrus cleaning,  paid  $50 for them to do a rush job. They said two days max. I get it back in 4 days, with many changes. The resolution was much smaller,  2 of the passwords were gone  (1 was my very important google account ). I could not retrieve it. They couldn't ether. Why not, they are the "experts). I went back to them, had a very heated argument of which the tech became rude using raw language and telling me I was p**sing him off. I  finally left the store very disappointed saying I would write a review, and I even threatened him with a letter from my brother-in-law who is an attorney.  Don't use this outfit,  stay away ! ! !

resp.text: The laptop was brought in on 12/14 at 11:25 in the morning, and was returned to Russ at 1:43 on 12/16. We were closed on this Saturday so I made a special trip just to meet him for pick  up.  I can provide receipts as proof of the time frame.  Mr Garcia had fallen for a scam artist and had allowed the person access to his computer. The laptop was terribly infected. I cleaned the system of the infections, tools, and changes made to his computer, which I cleaned and worked through midnight on Friday night to ensure he would have it back on Saturday.  To work on the computer I had to set the desktop magnifier back to normal 100% rather than 150% magnification. On opening Monday morning, 12/18, he came back into the shop very angry and abusive, complaining he couldn't see his desktop.  I set the desktop magnification back to 150%, and he told me about the password problem.  I tried to go through the 2 step verification with him to retrieve his password, but since he had previously done this multiple times at home , he had been put into "time out" by Google, telling him to come back and try again in a few hours.  He demanded that I call google and get it fixed, which google doesn't do (to my knowledge).  I asked him to be patient and try again later, but he continued to be abusive.  We did receive a message that the password was changed 6 days before, which would have been December 12.  He stated he thought he knew the password, but it didn't work.  I tried tell the customer that these safeguards were in place for the safety of his account and information, but he refused to believe that I couldn't just pick up the phone and call Google and get this problem fixed.  All other work was performed to his specifications.

text: Horrible experience after they racked charges without my consent and threatened quote "well I'll just keep your computer with all of your personal information on it then" when I refused to pay some larger amount I never agreed to, was never consulted with on, and was more than our original deal. I sent my computer to remove am admin password. They said it will be $30 but if they run into big issues, have to factory reset, or find viruses then it will be $60 more dollars but it won't be more than $90 total. They racked charges up and said it's $120 now. I said why they said there was viruses. I said you said if there was viruses it would be $60 more be said well it ended up taking longer than we thought it would top remove the viruses. Be told be it wouldn't me more than 90 total. Lied and racked charges and kept my computer because I won't pay that because that's not the amount we agreed on. They scam! I'm not one to usually complain unless you're really trying to screw me over and everyone who knows me knows that. Don't use this company. I'm contacting the better business bureau. Also the threat quote " we'll just keep your computer with all of your personal information on it" very unprofessional. I'm sure they'd say the same at anal claims and better business bureau I contacted. I have now paid $30 and an out the money and my computer because they increased the charges without my consent knowing they could just keep my computer do they thought they could just increase the amount if they wanted. It's bad business and scamming.

name: Rumple Stiltskin
text:
Pros:
-Friendly
-Convenient
-Punctual
- received ~$40 discount for towing two vehicles at the same time.

Cons:
-Had to manually type in credit card numbers.

UPDATE 5/6/2021
Monique contacted me after posting the review. We had severe thunderstorms so she made an appointment to come out yesterday (5/5/21).
1. The tire that was flat occurred because a stump likely nudged the tire slightly off the rim and caused it to deflate. Derrick aired up the tire and it's still inflated after ~24hours.
2. Derrick and Monique also took my car to fix the fender that was pulled away from the tire and now it looks as good as new.
3. As we were talking we mentioned our dog recently got into a fight with another dog that came on to our property and it's ears was bleeding and caused a lot of flies to irritate my dog. Monique offered a suggestion as a possible solution to prevent the flies from bothering my dog. We thought we had the product she mentioned on hand, but we didn't. When Monique and Derrick took my car to fix the fender, she brought back the product she had mentioned at no charge. We later put it on our dog and it seemed to help reduce the flies irritating our dog. THANKS!

Anyways, I hope I spelt their name correctly :P

Due to the urgency they wanted to correct the error that occurred as well as help our dog. I highly recommend them.

Original Review:
- i was moving from one house to another so i paid him on pickup and let him towed the vehicle to my other house. When i got home after  i finished getting things from the house I was moving from. I noticed the car he moved had damage near the front passenger tire.  The rear passenger tire was also popped. Neither of these were there before being towed.

text: Let me tell you about The Core, you guys. They are dependable, knowledgable, and flat out rockstars! Our business uses them for all of our technology needs. name: Elliott Salls
text: Took over 3 days to diagnose the problem. When diagnosed, I was told Apple had risen the price of Hard Drive power cables and that I needed a new Hard Drive and the anticipated cost would exceed $300. I was never contacted by The Core and I made every phone call to receive information regarding MY Mac Book. SLOW, SLOW, SLOW...they're there to expedite the process, not slow it down. After being told 3x's that my Hard Drive power cable would arrive the "next day", I was fed up with the process and proceeded to take my Mac Book to the University Supe Store, Apple Store (located in the Ferguson Center, at The University of Alabama)...and it was fixed in less than 4hours. Oh yea, and the final cost was only $40 for a new Hard Drive power cable and the installation. The actual Hard Drive was discovered...sorry The Core you're Apple privileges should be revoked strictly on your customer service, not to mention your "knowledge" of Apple products.

name: Jay Hamilton
text: I'm not saying that their actual service in person is lacking. I've actually heard great things about their store. However, I tried on multiple occassions to call them, and email them, and I couldn't get a response. I couldn't find time in my schedule to actually drive to their store, so this was pretty frustrating  I ended up taking my iMac issues to the SupeStore on UA's campus and they fixed my hard drive in a day.

name: Margaret Teare
text:
Great staff with incredible knowledge! Don't buy your equipment ANYWHERE else whether you are a company or an individual in West Alabama. Buying printers, computers, including Mac related products at their subsidiary, The Core, costs the same as buying at Best Buy, Staples, The Iphone Clinic, except you get to avoid set up problems, software and hardware conflicts and unnecessary downtime.

Its owner, Tuscom, AND The Core, is THE ONLY CERTIFIED Mac Reseller and SERVICE PROVIDER, in Tuscaloosa and Northport. Do not take your iPhone, iPad, Macbook Pro, Macbook Air to anyone else because if that company messes up your equipment a certified service provider CANNOT fix it legally. Just because the company has Iphone or Mac in its name, does mean that company is legally allowed to work on Mac products. Don't be fooled!

They troubleshot my Mac (for free) and uploaded my software and files to my new Mac for the same price as buying the computer. As my business grows, I will buy EVERYTHING from them. Run, don't walk, and sign up with these guys if you own a business, small or big. You will save so much money and headaches as you grow.   The employees will NEVER sell you anything you don't need AND will answer any question you have, whether, you are a tech newbie or a pro, in language that mirrors your level of knowledge. That kind of integrity is priceless.

Rob is great!

name: Jake William
text: great staff and workers always friendly to me

name: Arlesa Robinson

name: Danny Gammon
text: I have known Max Sessions for probably 30 years and have done business with him at various times and in various circumstances throughout those years.  I have witnessed his journey in the computer business through multiple locations and through multiple situations.  I don't think that I have ever experienced a more consistent and personable individual in the technology business.  First Max is knowledgeable and has stayed technologically current as the speed of change in the computer world has increased.  Max is genuinely interested in you and your particular problem.  His recommendations always combine a solution for your particular issue at the best price available.  He is great about taking the time understand what he thinks you will need and then giving you options so that you can make a decision that you will be comfortable with.  Lastly he is reliable, friendly, and truly appreciates you, his client, for allowing him to help you resolve your issue.  He probably has more clients who have turned into friends that any businessman I know.  I did not mean for this review to be so long but I wanted potential customers to really understand why I feel that Max Sessions Computer Solutions will provide you the best service, solution, and value for your computer or network technology needs and he will do it with a smile and on time.  I am also proud to call Max one of my best friends.

resp.text: Thanks Danny!

name: George Chambers
text: Despite the being listed as a business, the man who used to own the location works alone. He is very responsive and convenient to work with. I called to have my laptop fixed, and 24 hours later, he was done with the project and had cleaned the laptop to perfection. He is extremely kind and goes out of his way to give the customer a pleasant and easy experience. Unlike these larger repair companies that will get to your device at their own leisure, he prioritizes your needs in a swift fashion. I highly recommend this man to anyone who wants great customer service from an expert at a more than fair price.

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words George. It was a pleasure serving you!

name: Robin Brown
text: Excellent service! Max went above and beyond to help me. Got me exactly what I needed, and saved me time and money. NONE of the larger retail stores could compare. I had a lot of equipment to install, and found I was missing a very specific cable. I happened across his business info on Google, told him what I needed and that I was in a time crunch and trying to avoid driving to B'Ham in the middle of my work day to get the cable. I had all intentions of going to pick the cable up from him, but he brought it to me! You cannot ask for better, I recommend 10/10. Thanks Max!

name: Roger Ingram
text: The owner is very well educated in repairs. I took my computer in for repair and the owner told me what the issue was before even performing  diagnostics.  I checked it in and was pretty shocked to find out upon my return that he was absolutely correct with his over the counter assessment. Just happy to have my laptop back and its working great !

name: Brenda Patterson
text: Bought a computer from this place and I am very happy with the service and the purchase of my computer.   Staff is very polite and professional.  Great place to do business.

name: Bill Rogers
text: Very professionally staffed repair shop.  Staff is very knowledgeable and help me resolve my issues.  Also educated me on  new technology which help me save money on my cable and phone bill.   You wont go wrong with this place.

name: Clementine McGinnis
text: I am a committed customer of Computer Doctor and have been for approximately 5 years.  The services provided has been nothing less than outstanding.  The least positive feedback I can provide has to do with the ability to contact for updates on services or receive direct feedback without reaching out to the source.  However; this is a very "busy" company and it is understood that all phone calls cannot be answered or returned immediately.  My previous and current experience with Computer Doctor has been very satisfying.  My recommendation is most definitely a "five star".

name: Yarquitta Webster
text: My computer got hacked with a scammer attempting exploit money from me.  I took my laptop to the computer doctor and they disinfected my laptop and got me up and running again.   Great place to do business.

name: Elsagondo Wells
text: What can I say more?   I read the reviews before using this repair shop and decided to give them my business.  All I can say, the 5 star reviews are not fake! These guys know more about technology than anywhere else I've been. After Best Buy told me my motherboard was fried, Computer Doctor repaired my motherboard issue in the local shop and did not have to send anything offsite.  Its good to have a local shop that can repair electronics in-house.  I'm a customer for life!!

name: Judy Denham
text: Took my laptop in because it would not power on.  The doctor know what the problem was from his years of experience.  He advised me that the laptop is indeed powering on but there is no display.  He quoted me a price to repair the motherboard and told me I could pickup the next day.  I appreciate his knowledge and professionalism.  This place is well worth the visit and if I ever need any other word performed I will choose computer doctor again.

name: Judy Ruffer
text: I brought my computer to have it upgraded to windows 10.  In addition I spoke with them about  an email problem I was having with my spectrum email account.  I was not able to send or receive emails on my iPad, my Apple Watch, or my desktop computer.  I was advised that the issue was with me using an old Bright house email account.  The doctor took time to explain that when spectrum took over bright house, the  mail servers changed and i would need to be set up with the new settings.  He figured it all out and configured the proper setting on both my iPad and my Apple watch, and stated he would do the same on my desktop once its upgraded.  I love this place, they go above and beyond to satisfy the customer.

name: Walter Yarn
text: These guys are great and they really know technology.  They stay backed up with work so sometimes repair times can be a little longer. But the customer service is great and the work performed is well worth the wait.

name: Gay Moseley
text: I am a first time customer of computer doctor. I was referred by a friend who had a good experience.  I must say I too am very pleased with the service received.   Took some time to resolve my issue I assume because they are so busy.  I did notice a sign up stating that repair times were longer then normal due to a heavy work load.  I'm happy, excellent service.

name: jamacia rudolph
text: Horrible service I had an appointment and he kept giving me the run around changing  the time. He said he was leaving church and was only a few minutes away that turned into over an hour. I went elsewhere and was given much better service in a timely manner.

resp.text: This person has never done business with our company. People are so petty. Example:   if we are out on a service call and have a note on the door stating such, is it fair to leave us a negative review when you didnt have an appointment?  So how can you judge our service if you never contracted our service.  I guess this generation is doing what I refer to as  "Drive By" reviews.  Furthermore, in 15 years not one of our locations have ever been open on Sunday :-)

I went back to ask for my money back but they just pointed at their no refund sign called me a liar and said that it did go through and said that I have $100 in store credit now that I didn't even ask for. How are these people still in business? They are not BBB accredited and they have a bunch of fake reviews about how good they are. Its amazing how all the people who left positive reviews have only one review on google ever while all the negative ones have multiple.

text:
These guys are overpriced, unreliable, and will scam you out of your money. Brought my computer to get it checked and fixed. $175 dollars later they tell me its unfixable. Next i need data Transferred from one sd card to another and they wanna charge $100 for just that. Office depot charges $50. They charge you upfront as well and have a big NO REFUNDS sign behind them so if you swipe your card and try to cancel your order as your standing there they will NOT give it back even if you didn't use them for anything. Got scammed out of over $200 here cause they can't fix things.

In closing, go LITERALLY anywhere else before you go to these guys. It'll be cheaper, it'll be more reliable, and if they can't fix it more than likely they'll give you your money back. I know for a fact Office Depot will, Best Buy will, and Geek Squad will.

text: I've used Computer Doctor on two separate occasions, on two different Mac computers. Both times, I wasn't sure what was wrong, but I needed it fixed quick. text: Drove an hour to get computer fixed. We called a head of time and they were gone. Said they could help us in 45 mins but that would waste our whole day. 2 hours wasted.

resp.text: You called yesterday and inquired about our services.  However, YOU DID NOT MAKE AN APPOINTMENT FOR TODAY.  Had you made an appointment we would have available to accommodate you. Another customer called for an on-site service call and we were out taking care of that customer. It's customers like you that we have no desire to do business with in the first place, who take advantage of the system and leave negative reviews when you haven't done your part. We make no apologies for our actions as we were out servicing a customer who deserved service

name: Grace Pilgrim

text: Went above and beyond , I Came in and he fixed my laptop right away!

name: Carol wright
text: Seldom anyone there, but when he is, he is very helpful.

resp.text:
Mr Wright, I am ashamed of your comment. To give my company 3 stars just because we are not sitting around waiting on your arrival is not fair. Has it ever dawned on you that we are not sitting around twiddling our thumbs, we are not at the bowling alley having fun, we are not at a social party ,  we are working even when we are not at the store location. It's called out on a service call.

We have a sign permanently posted to the front door that states if we are not at the store please call the number listed and a rep will arrive to assist you within 15 minutes.  We have been at this location for 10 years, during that 10-year tenure my records show that we have service your computer needs just two times once in 2013 and once in 2014. Here it is 2018 that you show up and leave a negative review because you arrive one or two times and there's no one at the store to assist you. During our 10-year tenure there have been computer stores that have come and gone however we have survived, and the reason why we survived is because we do good work and most people obey the sign that is posted on the door.

If they come and we're not present they follow the instructions they simply pick up their cell phone dial the number listed and Presto a representative arrives within 15 minutes just as stated. You have been most unfair in your review, has it ever dawned on you that we are the only full service retail computer store that's in operation in Wetumpka also within a 20 to 30 mile radius? Shouldn't that alone tell you that we are busy and there will be times when we're not at the store?  You do know that we have a telephone number that most people call, even to make appointments.

Did you pick up the phone and call us to inquire about where we are what we're doing? All of the previous years that we've service you, you've never taken the time to say anything good let alone take the time to leave a positive review.  But here it is after 10 years of service you choose to leave a 3 star review not in regard to our work or the quality of work,  but you leave a 3 star review all because you arrived and no one was at the location, and you failed to pick up the phone call call.

We service residental and business customers alike, and we provide house calls and onsite service to both. When a business calls us and states there main business computer is down, we setup an onsite service call leave the store even at times when no one will be left to service the store. Why do we do this?  Its not personal its just business.  There is more money to be made in one business service call then there is for us to sit in the store waiting on residential customers to find the time to bring there computer in.   For you to reply to our absence as thow we are out on lake martin fishing rather than taking care of business is certianly not fair judgment. The good book says "Judge not lest you be judged, for the same measure in which you judge others, you will be judged".

Maybe the next time a solicitor comes to your residential door in an attempt to sell you a product and you're not home, maybe that's solicitor should log on to Google and leave you a negative review. Not based on the fact that you didn't buy his product, but a negative review based solely on the fact that you were not even home.

In closing, I would like for you to exercise your right to choose another store to do business with.  Best Buy would be the closest and is only 45 miles away from your residence.  I just can't see the logic in us continuing to service someone who has Judged us so unfairly. If you would like to discuss this matter further, our phone number has been the same now for 10 years. I hope you have a better day.

name: Heather Jones Bennett
text: Bob was so helpful and knowledgeable. He stocked the part I needed and repaired my phone in 2 hours. The level of service I received was top notch and is rarely seen nowadays. 5 stars and 2 thumbs up! He also sells phones for great prices.

name: SaintMegery15
text: So, walked in and was promptly greeted. Explained that I needed my screen replaced on my iPhone. I take it out to show the guy and he presses all over it, and while he is telling me my battery is swollen and causing the screen to bend, he turns it on and my screen was split in half! I couldn't use half my screen! I work 2 blocks away and have been very careful with my phone (have had a bent-ish screen for months!) so I really don't think this happened in my pocket. I called him out on it as soon as I saw the screen and he said "Look, you can't even use the screen now". He proceeded to talk about other things with my phone and didn't address the problem of him breaking my screen. He priced a screen and battery for me, but I declined and walked out because he broke my screen and absolutely refused to acknowledge it. I went back to the office, called this place and asked to speak to the manager. He asked what was wrong and I told him about the staff breaking my screen. He reveals that the guy I'm speaking with on the phone is the one who "helped" me in the store, and said that he is the manager and owned the store. I calmly explained to him what he did and how I watched him do it right in front of my face. He REFUSED to take responsibility and tried offering a $10 discount for both screen and battery instead. I said no thanks, and to have a nice day before hanging up. I am SO upset - I ended up just buying a new phone since it was about the same cost of what he would charge for a screen and battery. Find someone honest and who knows what they are doing to fix your cell phone - not here!

resp.text: Megan we’re sorry you had a bad experience with us and we do remember your issue. You came in with a swollen battery and an already cracked screen. The phone was off when you came in and we turned it on to a discolored lcd. You came in with a cracked screen and swollen battery and left with a cracked screen and swollen battery even after giving you a special repair price due to the repair being more than one issue and you mentioned working near by as we do like to be extra friendly with our neighbors and business close to our locations. The price you were given is a price no other repair store would give and if they did we would match but in all we’re sorry for any inconvenience you may have had coming to our store and would like to mention that the special price quote still stands if you wish to stop by. Thank you and have a great day!

name: Jeff Jones
text: I spent hours at Best Buy and 30 minutes at the Genius Bar. They all gave up on fixing my iPhone 6 (using Apple’s approved troubleshoot and repair process). text: This place uses poor quality screens. Do yourself a favor and avoid this place. Got my iPhone screen replaced a few month ago. I went back again and had to argue since they wanted to charge me to replace the defect screen. Eventually they replaced it for free. After a few weeks  the new screen started to malfunction, AGAIN. text:
I took a chromebook into UAB Phone Clinic. I asked the owner if he could
tell me why the charger would not go in the charging port. He took the chromebook to the back and came it 5 minutes later and said that he replaced the charging port and I owed him $70. A few days later ( 8 days )
later I cannot put the charger in the charging port. I called UAB clinic and a man said answered and said they were closing for the day and I could come in on Monday. I really needed to use the computer so I took it to another repair shop and told them that I just had the charging port replaced and I couldn't figure out what was wrong. UAB Phone Clinic had not repaired the charging port. The original port was still in the computer.
Evidently the man at UAB just straightened out the pins and charged me for a new charging port. Be very careful in UAB Phone Clinic. I wish I would have read through the reviews. I noticed that there were 5 stars but didn't take the time to read through them. I have talked to several people that have had bad experiences with this place but didn't take the time to

Hey Richard,

Please call or txt me at 2058875151

name: Shir
text:
I came in a few months ago with a cracked screen and the screen was replaced. A couple of weeks later my phone was dropped the phone landed on the corner with the case taking direct impact. I also had a screen protector. The screen cracked in the corner.

I have had my phone for a couple of years and the only time the screen cracked previously was when it landed face first without the screen protector. This leads me to believe the quality of the aftermarket screen was not very good.

resp.text:
Hello  Shir, we’re sorry you had a bad experience with us. Aftermarket screens have the same durability as the oem quality the difference is in the picture quality of the lcd only but the glass is the same, also it’s hard to compare the drop it took recently to previous drop lots of factors come into play. You also mentioned it was dropped on the corner of screen which is a very critical place of impact it’s the easiest place to crack on an iPhone specially if it’s the plus size phone but if you stop by we will try our best to make sure you get a better experience with us with a discounted price and free screen protector.

Thank you
Phone Clinic management

text: Phenomenal service - they make the experience of having an issue with your phone, generally a pretty annoying time, far, far less frustrating. They take the time to explain you your issues, offer many different solutions, and best of all work honestly to do their best for you. Tried two other places, that was a mistake, other places didn't hear what I was saying. Whereas the Phone Clinic listened to what I had already done, how the problem developed, and what I wanted done. If you want confidence and sincerity in a business, this is where you come. Recommending to all my friends who have phone issues. There is a reason why this has a near unanimous 5 star rating.

resp.text:
Dear Old Man,

When you buy tech at Experimax, you are buying more than just a "Device".   You are buying the best personal-tech customer service experience in Mobile, AL.  Read some of our other reviews and you can hear it straight from our customer's mouths. We specialize in all Computer, Tablet and Smart Phone technology.    We Buy and Sell, Trade and Upgrade, and can Fix ANY type of Computer, Tablet or Smart Phone Technology.  We charge a fair price for certified pre-owned Apple devices in excellent Grade A condition each including a one year warranty.  All devices come with free data migration and personal one-to-one device training and on going support.

Give us a chance and we will prove to you that it is worth every penny for the  Experimax Experience!!!

Kindest regards,

Cosmo

name: Jacqueline Brooks
text: I have an older iPhone that that was locked in recovery mode.I took it to the geeks at Best Buy .I was ignored for awhile then one of their so called Geeks ask me if he could help. I explained the situation, he was very rude , cold and really seemed to care less that I was concerned that I was about to lose all my data ,contacts and photo,s ( especially I told him my mom's pics who had passed away) . He took the phone and came back in 10 minutes and said your phone is crashed. There is no way to recover the data and he could not even restore back to factory settings so maybe I could recover some data from I cloud.I was devastated to say the least.I do not own a computer but I do have an iPad ( old too ) .I found this place and Austin was very helpful, friendly, professional and seemed to really want to help me.He tried about 4 or more times to restore my phone so I could recover my precious data. He was not giving up, he had the knowledge to see the phone had potential to restore from the computer by the way it was trying to reconnect . I recommend everyone if anyone can fix your phone this guy Austin will if possible. He was so nice and really determined to help me.The price was very reasonable and the customer service was outstanding. I will tell everyone about this place, and the geek squad is a joke.They are a bunch of young kids who are just running around with their nose up in the air like they know it all.They definetly do not know much about Apple Products and how the I cloud stores you info. You just have to know how to get it and Austin did. Thank you again Austin, you saved me.

resp.text: We are excited to hear that you had a great customer service experience at Experimax.  We don't have geeks we Tech Advisors!  Thanks for the 5 stars!!!

name: av8rwood
text:
I'm a 62 year old, 17 year Mac owner and I had the FIRST problem with my 10 year old IMac (the reason I've stayed with Apple) and after being all but laughed out of local repair service, I searched and found Experimac in Mobile. After a very cordial and informative conversation with Cosmo on the phone, I decided to make the 150 mile trek to Mobile with my geriatric IMac. I was NOT disappointed. Cosmo and his crew are very easy to work with and after explaining my options they happily accepted my decision to go ahead and revive my old friend. I needed the machine to finish work I had started though I do expect to replace it in the near future. We discussed several tempting, money saving options for that replacement when the time quickly comes.

name: Jonny Gaston - Evangelist
text:
I really was hopeful that this business would be a overall pleasant experience. Got my 2017 IPad fixed there. Customer service was great in the beginning. But then it took extra long for them to repair my iPad. Cosmo said 5 days. I still had no iPad for 12-14 days. Every time I called they gave me the “run-around”
They left some messages and they also was waiting on me to give the ok to wipe my iPad since it was disabled. However when I called because I still had no idea when I would get it back, all I got was excuses why it was my fault it had not been repaired yet.

I finally got it back when I pressed them to make it happen. And they did a good job at the repair. I might even give them another shot and change my review, but for now my experience was frustrating. All I needed them to say was “Hey , sorry that’s our fault for giving you an unrealistic timeframe for the repair, we are going to make this right!”

But all I got from them was a bit of an attitude and excuses.

I need my Mac book fixed as well. I might go else where. But I am not closed to giving them another chance. Maybe they were just having a bad day. I’m not sure. I wish my experience was better.

resp.text: I’m sorry that your experience was less than ideal and we will try to set better time expectations for you in the future.   Since the device was disabled we didn’t want to reset the device to factory without your permission since doing so deletes all the data on the device.  In hindsight, we should of gotten your permission to reset the device when you dropped it off with us.  Had we done so, the repair would of been completed much more quickly.   I hope that you do give us another chance to serve you, and I promise we will get your MacBook fixed in a timely manner.

resp.text: Thanks for the great review, we can fix anything!

name: John Bobbitt
text:
Called them regarding some new, and some used parts id like to sell from an aborted build, plus others besides. Told them exactly what (SPSPECIFICALLY AN INTEL PROCESSOR, expandable RAM, motherboards, lcd screen,) I had and they told me to come on. I went to probably irritating lengths to confirm that they bought these highly specific parts. In retrospect, I thought the name,odd, but after a long day didnt put the "mac" portion together....or I'd have asked SPECIFICALLY if they bought non-mac items. So,  I drove out from Theodore during rush hour....and they declined everything because it wasnt MAC (wed discussed what I had, mind you) and because they couldn't test board soldered parts.... He said that in refereme to RAM memory chips, a desktop cpu, and my 500gb hard drives...they only take solid state now, he said. And so on, and so on...

I dunno what the game they were playing was, but I think experimac owes me a half tank of gas and an appology. Take the gas from the guy's paycheck (if you're paying guys who think UPGRADABLE RAM is soldered to the board, anyway. And processors and graphics cards for that matter) for so politely convincing me to bring it all out there after being given models and brands.  Everything I could do to maintain some class before I left. Nothing worse than going out of your way to ensure its not a fruitless trip, only to get there and find some genius has given you bad info...and then instead of owning it....lying through his teeth ever so easily with a smile on his face. Aparently my cloths from a day under my cars hood, disguised my occupation as an aerospace engineer.... and I looked like someone who believed hard drives require soldering. In the parking lot now trying to figure gasoline vs. Dive distance.

RESPONSE TO BUSINESS: No, I'm passing. At this point, I believe ive done what's necessary to prevent this happening to someone else. I've made them aware. You know who screwed the pooch, you know what they did...and for that matter, the african American young man who provides the quotes (according to the Liar) knew, and yet hid in the back and let the guy I dealt with do his thing. I'm wondering if THAT is in the fact Cosmo you speak of. In which case, he didnt do anything then, so I dont believe hed do anything NOW. I dont believe your store would have poated a response at all, if not for the star by my name.

You intentionally ignored my suggestion of gas compensation, and while your words are very well put together to give the impression of being amicable....the previous young mans words were pretty enough to get me out there. Fool me once, sir....yet not twice.

A whole paragraph you've written in response that says essentially... Nothing.

2 weeks Later: See folks? Still no response... Just ran and hid. Guilty.

resp.text: We apologize that we did not make it clear over the phone that we only buy Apple products.  You should of been told this over the phone.  We want to talk with you about the experience so that we can avoid something like this happening to anyone else.  Please call us at the store 251-308-8276 and ask for Cosmo.

text:
I took my phone in last week to get repaired. By that evening my phone screen went completely black ,and didn't turn back on. I returned the next day to explain that I was just there 24 hours before and my phone didn't work. He verified the purchase and fixed it again. The graphics aren't the same. It has been 7 days and my phone keyboard types on its own and continues to shift between apps, makes calls, and taps on things without me touching it. I will not be returning to this location
Very bad service 😢

name: Caitlin Elliott
text: So, walked in and was promptly greeted. Explained that I needed my screen replaced on my iPhone. I take it out to show the guy and he presses all over it, and while he is telling me my battery is swollen and causing the screen to bend, he turns it on and my screen was split in half! I couldn't use half my screen! I work 2 blocks away and have been very careful with my phone (have had a bent-ish screen for months!) so I really don't think this happened in my pocket. I called him out on it as soon as I saw the screen and he said "Look, you can't even use the screen now". He proceeded to talk about other things with my phone and didn't address the problem of him breaking my screen. He priced a screen and battery for me, but I declined and walked out because he broke my screen and absolutely refused to acknowledge it. I went back to the office, called this place and asked to speak to the manager. He asked what was wrong and I told him about the staff breaking my screen. He reveals that the guy I'm speaking with on the phone is the one who "helped" me in the store, and said that he is the manager and owned the store. I calmly explained to him what he did and how I watched him do it right in front of my face. He REFUSED to take responsibility and tried offering a $10 discount for both screen and battery instead. I said no thanks, and to have a nice day before hanging up. I am SO upset - I ended up just buying a new phone since it was about the same cost of what he would charge for a screen and battery. Find someone honest and who knows what they are doing to fix your cell phone - not here!

name: Ty Hampton
text: DO NOT COME HERE!!! They put a CHEAP screen on your phone and do it poorly. I came in and they put a LCD on my iPhone X even though it's supposed to use an OLED. Then the screen keeps scrolling on its own. They tell me to bring it in, so I do. I can't replicate the problem (because I'm not a glitch genie? What do they want?) and so they won't fix it without seeing the problem. WASTE OF MONEY AND POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!! You'd be better off taking a hammer to your phone.

text: I have to say the iPhone clinic here on 15th st in Tuscaloosa has to be hands down the best place to take any iPhone or apple product & the service is quick and over the top , I won’t go anywhere else .

name: Candice P. Brownlee
text: I took my iPhone in today to have my cracked screen repaired (at the 15th Street location). The nice man that helped me told me the cost upfront ($130 + tax) and told me it would take about 30 minutes to repair. To me, this was acceptable, fair pricing and excellent timing. Imagine my surprise when he came back 10 minutes later and told me it would only be $10 and my phone was fixed!!! I couldn’t believe it! He informed me that my actual screen wasn’t cracked but that my screen protector sheet was just in bad shape. (It legit LOOKED like it had seeeeveral cracks and several shattered, busted  corners.) I say that to say this... I would’ve never known the difference! He could’ve came back to the counter and still charged me the $130 and I would’ve never known the difference & would have HAPPILY paid it. The Phone Clinic Tuscaloosa COULD HAVE taken advantage of me and again, I would have NEVER KNOWN. I think this SPEAKS VOLUMES of the integrity & honesty of Phone Clinic Tuscaloosa!!! I caught a $120 break today which was much appreciated! I would do business here 100x’s again—even *IF* I ever do have a legit busted screen. My boss recommended me to Phone Clinic Tuscaloosa and I will HIGHLY RECOMMEND them to everyone I know as well! Good people you can TRUST!!! Thank you for the 5-star service today, Phone Clinic Tuscaloosa! I appreciate you more than you know! :-)

Then they determined that my phone's logicboard was broken and switched my battery free of charge so I could use my phone again. Great customer service and genuinely good people!

name: Julia Ruderman
text: This happened last February, but I just got around to writing a review now. I broke the LCD screen of my Samsung Galaxy 6 and brought it in to be repaired. They asked for my phone number (I clarified that they wanted the number of the phone I was leaving with them), and told me to come back in a few hours. A few hours later, I come back and they haven't done anything yet. They said they'd have to replace the frame of my phone (because it would break when they removed it) as well but they didn't have a matching gold one in stock and needed my permission to use a white frame instead. The guy said "we called you but couldn't get in touch"...well yeah, you called the phone in your hand. So whatever, I come back a few hours later and it's still not done and I have to wait another half hour. I finally get it back and the frame is extended a few millimeters from the front of my phone- hard to describe but made it more difficult to press the home button and felt very fragile. A few months later, the frame is starting to peel off and I hear a crackling noise every time I press the screen. I took it to a different phone repair place back home, where I was told the first repair was incredibly sloppy. The guy there told me the first repair hadn't even glued the frame back on and it was a miracle it hadn't fallen off yet. For less than $50 (and in under an hour), he glued it on correctly and my phone looks new (aside from the mismatched front). I'm giving 2 stars because I understand things like the mismatched frame isn't their fault, and I knew it was going to be pricey, but overall it was not a good experience at all.

resp.text: Please contact us and let us know how we can improve. Phoneclinictuscaloosa@gmail.com

I had them replace my iPhone 6S Plus LED screen and glass panel for $120. That cracked the glass screen across the top of my phone and they want another $70 to replace the screen again! Even though it's only cracked because it wasn't reassembled correctly after the initial repair!

I will absolutely be finding another company to repair my iPhone. That is some extremely poor customer service. I'm extremely disappointed...

resp.text:
Hey Tyler sorry to hear that. But in electronic world you will be given "Limited warranty" which will not cover physical damages. When you have any complains you need to bring it before you crack.

We ate not production facility, we buys this parts from our suppliers, which give us limited warranty as well.

In this incidences we offer cost price policy to our customers.

However I am ready to help you more if you can call or txt at 205 887 5151

resp.text:
Luckily there is something called surveillance camera with advanced sound system.

This person clearly states that he is ready to take the risk and accepts the statement read told to him orally by our technician.

There is nothing written that is correct but we are experienced enough to know that in certain phones like "Chinese Huawei" brand there are some complications due to design of the phone:

As another example Samsung galaxy S5 has all the main screws underneath the screen. To do any internal work one needs to remove the screen, which is risky. We always mention this.

It is not fair to blame others afterwards.

This person takes the phone to our fellow repair shop and they fixed it  for him for 240$ just the screen. Cause part is very costly.

text: I went in with a working phone just battery was dying fast. Got there around 10 am paid for a new battery waited a few hours like I was told returned with the same issue. They took my phone to the back came back said they over heated it and it no longer works. I had a iPhone 6. They refused to replace my phone. I called the cops and still nothing was done. DO NOT TAKE YOUR Phone TO THEM EVER!!!!

resp.text:
Hey Nakia. As far as I learned from the technician your Motherboard was heating and draining battery. There was a short circuit or some burned diode. Initially we could not notice it and per your request changed the battery.

Then the second time you came back we let you to touch your motherboard by your own hands, We have the video record of it. which you could not touch even for a second. It was burning almost

So lets make it clear it is not we heated your board. It was your board was overheating. We told you it can burn PMU (Power management ic chip) if keep trying it. You said go ahead and work on it.

We offered you refund back on battery we installed but you tried different ways to get over and ask for a brand new phone.

First of all if you come to us its because your phone does not work well. It is 3 years old phone with heating board.

we just took our battery of it and refunded you 45$

Sorry but we can not buy you a brand new iPhone 7 to make you happy.

Note: you sat in the store 8 hours in front desk and gave all the customers entering store bad reputation. This is not ethical at all.

name: Jeff Cunningham
text: Liars,I dropped off my Samsung with them paid 100.00 to fix it .they said it would be ready in two to three days so after not hearing from them I called ,said part hadn't arrived will be ready in 3 days .again no response so I went there 7 days 8 days from the initial drop off.I was told part would be in in 5 days so I came back.part hasn't arrived I'm told by a Arab fellow behind the counter after a heavy set white fellow said he would have to check and see what was wrong, and seemEd to give me a weird vibe in his way of acting .then Arab guy says your part is in Oregon should be here in 5 days and said so what do you want to do ? I say just give me my phone and a refund I'll take it elsewhere. I had already spent money on another phone that I brought home and doesn't work but I wasn't going to say anything about it.so then he says we can't do that ! I asked why and his answer was store policy ! It's my phone I own it ,it's my money ,I have had no service plus at the time it was 13 days far from the original 2 or 3 I was told .then he couldn't find my phone so I waited approximately 30 mins and the white guy comes out and says and you could see he was stalling.and said so what are you going to do?I said I'm waiting on my phone and my money.the Arab guy comes back hollering at the back find that phone .said I wasn't listening and I wasn't getting anything and proceeds to pull a sticker off my phone.I said I want my phone my money and leave that sticker on it .he said he didn't have to.took the sticker off and my phone to the back.at this point I was outraged,grabbed his moniter layer it over a said give me my damn phone and he called the police,police said it was a litagation issue when I talked to them and the thievery was not a 911 police matter .also if you look at the mama's of the 5 stars on this page you will find common ground in 85% of the names ! Today is day 19 one extra day from the last time I spoke with the liars at the phone clinic, I'll be returning to check in on things today with a real phone tech.and offer them one last chance to let them make it right,today ! The business is out of my way and would have never even went there had I not called ahead of time and was told the normal wait was a hour  ! I expect some kind of lie as a reply on here and I also feel I've been robbed by this business at this point ! BEWARE!

resp.text: We apologize for this unfortunate experience. Please contact us so we can right this wrong. Phoneclinictuscaloosa@gmail.com

name: Homero El Malo
text:
(Translated by Google) They repair your cell phone the same day (it takes about 3 hours), but first you have to go to make a previous diagnosis, for this you have to go to the laboratory, leave an advance so that they order the accessory or damaged part and wait for the delivery time which is indicated on the day of the diagnosis (all that time you keep the equipment with you). On the agreed day you have to call to find out if the part finally arrived and if so, you take the equipment and they repair it instantly, excellent service.

(Original)
Te reparan el celular el mismo día (toma alrededor de 3 horas), pero primero hay que ir a realizar un diagnóstico previo, para esto hay que ir al laboratorio, dejar un anticipo para que realizen el pedido del accesorio o pieza dañada y esperar por el tiempo de entrega la cual se te indica el día del diagnostico (todo ese tiempo mantienes el equipo contigo). En el día acordado hay que llamar para saber si la pieza finalmente llego y de ser así llevas el equipo y te lo reparan en el instante, excelente servicio.

name: Jazlyn Terry
text:
Name should be: ubreakibreakmore

Brought my Google Pixel 4XL in to have a screen replacement through Verizon insurance. I dropped off the phone at 10am and agreed to a 4-6 hour wait time. Everything worked on the phone when it was dropped off, damage was strictly cosmetic (I have a receipt with a checklist and phone history to prove this). Gave another phone number for shop to call when finished. I return at 6:30pm (because shop closes at 7) to see what is going on with my phone and they bring it out with a still broken screen. They could not fix the screen, but apparently messed up more in the process. The phone will now not function AT ALL. It will not even turn off. I was not given any resolution other than call Verizon and file a claim, which is the exact reason I was here to start with.

STAY AWAY!!!!

text: Fast scheduling, part was in inventory when I called (Pixel 3a screen). As a Google authorized service provider, I had confidence going in, and I wasn't disappointed. Jason did a fantastic repair, efficient, and courteous. Highly recommended! Hope I don't have to go back, but if necessary, I will!

text:
Great place to get your electronics fixed. I had to get a Galaxy Note 9 screen replaced, the website gives you an exact quote of how much it will cost. It wasn't too bad, I five other repair shops both in Madison and Huntsville, they all gave me about the same price for the repair. The technician gave me an estimated wait time (an hour) and said it will be done by then. I got called within 45 minutes, and the screen was as good as new. Pretty straight forward process.

The price was decent compared to what it would cost me to buy the screen from a supplier, labor cost wasn't too bad either. They did a fine job. Thanks!

resp.text: Hello Rickey, we are glad we were able to help get your Note 9 back up and running! We always strive to provide quick and affordable repairs using only the highest quality parts, and we are happy to assist you with any future repair needs!

name: Richard Swaim
text: My iPhone had a broken screen and housing (back glass) when I brought it in for repairs.  Anthony explained the process thoroughly and provided me with a loaner phone because they didn’t have the housing in stock.  The part was overnighted to the store and repaired the next day.  Unfortunately, due to a defect in my particular phone the repair was unsuccessful and had to have some sort of wiring replaced for the home button- which needed to be done by Apple in California.  Anthony again communicated very well and advised me of every step throughout the process. He worked tirelessly and even came in on his off day to get it resolved.  My phone was replaced and is now working better than ever.  Anthony is an asset to this company.  His customer service and communication skills are fantastic and were throughout the entire process.  I will recommend these guys to all my friends and family and would not hesitate to take my devices back if any repairs are needed in the future.

resp.text: Hello Richard! Thank you very much for leaving us a 5 star review! We take customer service very seriously, and are glad that we were able to assist!

text: I’d give 10 stars if possible.  I recently came in the the new Huntsville store on 72 (near Madison) with a friend visiting from Guatemala who accidentally cracked the back of his new iPhone 10XS Max.  The Guatemalan friend was headed back home soon, so the guys at UBREAKIFIX rushed ordered the part and did an amazing job in a quick turn-around repair.   Most importantly, the UBREAKIFIX repair was $400 less than what Apple charges!  The gentleman at UBREAKIFIX were incredibly knowledgeable, professional, courteous and exceedingly helpful.  Bottom line is that I would never go anywhere else for phone repairs, and I will surely recommend this place to my friends and colleagues at work.

name: Heather Bartlett
text:
If you like waiting your gas and time...this is the place to go!

Let me start off by saying I made an appointment a week in advance I also called before I made the appointment! I use my phone for work everyday and I'm from Cullman, every local place said they would need my phone for 3 days so I took off work a saturday and made the appointment as soon as I got off the phone with them to get my s10 plus screen replaced, because they said they had it and it would be done that day, they seem to this there was some miscommunication and didnt hear the plus, which I would have been a little bit more understanding if I didnt make an online appointment a week early, I put exactly what I needed and what phone I had color and all they had one screen but it was the wrong color and because they are a samsung partners the back has to be the same color? I walked out of that place with no help, no suggestions, I felt like they could not care less if I walked out having drove over an hour, to me, this is one of the worse customer service experiences I have ever had, this was clearly a mistake on their side yet nothing was done to even try and make it right! A shout out to companies that care...batteries + bulbs went out of their way to make sure this other companies mistake was created, not only did they get it fixed but due to bad weather they let me get out of there quick and jumped right on everything! I get mistakes happen, but I also understand customers are what make a business, I got not even an apology management was called and I was told theres nothing I can do but order one! name: Jason Willis
text:
Called about getting my phone fixed,Said they could do it no problem for $80.00. Drove 45 miles to their store was told it'd be $300.00 just for parts.  Found another place that fixed it for $85.00 in 45 minutes. I hate being lied to to get business.
Edit for reply:
My wife called Tuesday 1/5/21 and told whoever answered the phone, after telling them my issue (power button on my Samsung Galaxy S10 plus fell off). She was told that it wouldn't be a problem and no appointment needed that it'd be $79.00. As I mentioned before I live 45 miles away, I had to leave work early to make sure I had ample time to get there and to get service.
Yes, you are correct,  there was not a record or service ticket made because the guy there looked at my phone said that I'd have to leave it and that the parts would be $300.00 because the board would have to be changed out that the button was all one unit. I value my time and money as much as everyone else and I left without your service. Yes, I do feel like the initial phone call was a bait and switch just to get someone in the store. You know that $19.99 oil change costs $500 because you need tires,wipers, injector cleaning and "blinker fluid". It's just strange that my wife was told one thing and I was told another. I called another shop  told them exactly what was wrong, they said same thing. No problem, no appointment needed.  Took phone, they looked at it and the fixed it for the amount quoted.
Funny thing that one shop said one thing and the other one did it.

resp.text:
Jason, I cannot find a repair ticket or record of your name, are you sure you have the right place? If so, I would like to reach out to you to find out what happened, as we do not give bogus pricing to obtain business. Mistakes do happen and if this indeed did happen, I'd love the chance to make it right!

We have a proven track record of being transparent throughout our entire repair process and we pride ourselves on having some of the best pricing in the industry. I especially appreciate this review because it gives me a chance to explain our repair process.

Before I start, i'd like to point out one thing, there is a giant discrepancy between $80.00 and $300.00. The only phone parts that cost this much are some of the Genuine Samsung Display Assemblies. If another shop was able to resolve this for $85.00, it was a small part repair, like a charging port or proxy sensor, for example. (If parts were needed.) My point is, our prices would have been comparable.

When a customer calls in to obtain a price on a particular repair we do our best to go over the details of the problem or issue they are experiencing. If we are confident we know the solution to the issue at hand, we then will give you a price or at least a ballpark figure, so they know what to expect. If we are unsure what the solution is to the issue, we will ask you to bring the device in to be diagnosed, before giving you a price on the repair.

The Process.

1. Once you come into our office, we go over the details of the issue you are experiencing with your device. We will then go over repair solutions or inform you that it will need further diagnostics to obtain the solution to the issue.

2. We then obtain all your contact information and create you a ticket. We may at this time give you a price on the repair. Below are a couple normal situations.

*Lets go over a couple examples, an iPhone 8, the screen is damaged, everything else on the device is working as intended (we verify this,) we give you a price on the display assembly replacement and an ETA for expected completion.

*Now, lets say its a Gaming Computer, it is randomly turning off or blue screening. We will not know what the issue is without diagnosing all the hardware. In this situation, we will inform you that we will need to perform additional diagnostics to know what it will take to repair this device.

3. Once we have obtained the device, we then will start the diagnostics or repair in the order that it came in. We have other repairs in front of new repairs. Your device will go into the queue and will be worked on when its ticket is next. There are two exceptions to this. Most phone screen repairs, if we have the parts on hand (which we do for all iPhones and some Samsungs,) are completed in an hour or less. (Time will vary depending on the particular repair.) The other exception is, we offer a rush service, this service is paid at the time of when you drop off the device. This is paid to have the device worked on immediately, otherwise tickets are worked on in the order they are received.

4. Once the repair or diagnosis is completed, we then will email, text, and/or call you, to go over any final or further details.

5. Pick up your device and pay for the repairs. Once a repair is completed you can come by and pick up your device at your convenience. We also offer payment options, you can pay in person with cash or card, or you can pay your invoice through our online portal.

**One quick notes, due to COVID-19, we are not allowing our customers to wait on repairs in the lobby. They must either drop them off, wait in the their car, or outside of the building.

Jason, thank you for allowing us to go over this process with you and potential customers that may be reading this. Feel free to reach out to me, Clint Silver, owner at ProTek. I would love to know what happened and would love the opportunity to make it right. Thank you and as always, thanks for choosing ProTek!
